author: {'steamid': '76561198187166373', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3682, 'playtime_at_review': 3682, 'last_played': 1712334525}
review: Power Creep is just too much. I started in 2017, easily made it to gold ranks with bakuras fiend and Zorc deck then left duel links for 7 years have just come back to play in 2024 and the power creep is way too much. This is supposed to be an easier alternative to the less competitive real game but instead Konami love their money so they have allowed one turn sweep wins just like the real game which completely defeats the purpose in which duel links was created for in the first place. So have uninstalled and removed this game from my list im not wasting time going for full achievements if i cant have any fun playing the entirety of the game. I voluntarily choose not to play full meta myself if i want to do that i can use YGO pro as i have done in the past. Ive won multiple tournaments in real life and have won thousands of duels on YGO pro so i know what it feels like to use a meta killing deck but on duel links i just want to use my Bakura Zorc deck like i used to and go all the way with it. Sadly I cant, Konami love raking in their money and they have just turned this into a full on pay to win meta game with zero fun or enjoyment

author: {'steamid': '76561198213017316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 599, 'playtime_at_review': 14850, 'last_played': 1712244933}
review:
É um bom jogo pois decks antigos tem maior potencial do que no jogo comum. O meta varia muito mais do que nos demais jogos da série. Ele tem uma estrutura de balanceamento que é longe de ser perfeita, mas sem dúvidas que há mais do que no concorrente (monster duel). Outro ponto bom é que o jogo SEMPRE tem evento, você sempre consegue gemas e farmar o que quiser, por vezes têm até um evento grande e eventos secundários menores acontecendo ao mesmo tempo em que são fáceis de se conseguir os prêmios.

O ponto ruim é a dificuldade de se conseguir alguns cards especificos. Se quiser 3 de algumas cartas ultra raras, por vezes você vai gastar muito resetando caixas, ou pode conseguir através de bilhetes dos sonhos que têm uma certa frequencia que são distribuidos em eventos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198943943457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14930, 'last_played': 1616297204}
review:
Resumo para preguiçoso, se você não é competitivo não é pra você o jogo é da Konami e isso o faz automaticamente PAY TO WIN ou seja vai perder muito tempo por que o jogo de cartas é viciante e raiva porque você provavelmente tem bom senso e não vai ficar gastando seu dinheiro nesse jogo pay to win.
Se você tem tempo a perder e é competitivo vai nessa, o jogo tem muitas atualizações e eventos já que a Konami quer extrair seu dinheiro com novas cartas, mas a jogabilidade é boa e viciante. 

Em geral recomendo esse jogo de cartas é muito bom e esse jogo é bem feito e entrega o que promete mesmo a Konami sendo uma mercenária e se esforçando para acabar com essa franquia.

review:
If you are a fan of the Yu-Gi-Oh! Game then I'd recommend this to you. It's the only official way to play Rush Duel in America and is not that unfun. I mean there's meta but with Yu-Gi-Oh especially when is there not. 

I'd recommend it although if you want to rise up in the ranks get ready to not do anything interesting while you grind gems for the meta deck you need. 

A lot better than Master Duel though

review:
Mouais moyen, en moins d'une heure le jeu m'a lassé, je lance le jeu, je suis harcelé de notif, les erreurs de connexion alors que la connexion va bien. Gameplay mou, interface moyenne.
À peine commencé le jeu, on me propose de dépenser mon argent pour des cartes… donc pay to win forcé là.
Malgré ça, on peut débloquer des personnages puis collectionner les cartes, peut-être un jour, j'y jouerai, mais là, il ne donne pas envie.

author: {'steamid': '76561199066260356', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 126, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1711774791}
review:
Play your favorite character and win your duels.
Win你个头，我玩DL 就是为了天成快斗的，现在被砍技能快斗的银河眼现在先手做不了银河眼光子卿，后场突破不稳定。本家亏卡没抗性，斩杀不了或被康基本等死，魂不了一点。真就技能决定部分卡组强度。

还有卡太贵了，隔壁md至少还能碎卡换，dl就摁抽。想玩个闪刀运气不好要抽完三盒卡才能凑齐三张零。卡组淘汰又不能换成新资源，wnm

Jogo casualmente, quero platinar e ser pelo menos Top 1000 global. Claro que tem os manos que vem com deck quebrado que é (literal) impossível de vencer. Só que NORMALMENTE esses decks são banidos de torneios oficial. Comunidade é da hora mas tem os manos q querem vencer a qualquer custo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803038655', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 22395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 823, 'playtime_at_review': 22277, 'last_played': 1711467030}
review:
Extremely grindy, time intensive and expensive to attain anything resembling a competent or constructed decklist for speed duels due to the years and years of progression you will need to catch up on on top of the awful gacha system of obtaining cards and the lack of a crafting system in comparison to something like Masterduel. The rate at which you earn gems to pull for packs is abysmall, you typically get 1/5th of the amount needed for 1 pack out of the hundreds you need from a box for just playing and ranking up amongst other events and even doing all weeklies will barely get you 2 packs, it is impossible to remain F2P in Speed Duels Duel Links. This is the only official way to play speed duels online sadly and in the TCG Speed duels have been in this weird limbo state for a while so this entire alt format is sort of a mess but this is definitely not the way to experience it if you want to.

HOWEVER, most of what I said only applies to the speed duels side of things since Duel Links for whatever reason started having rush duels as well and they are so much better than the current speed duel state of things its not even funny. This is also the only way to play rush duels in the west since for some reason they are completely locked to Japan/OCG side of things despite how long they have been a thing over there and the popularity of them in duel links, also a strange decision to make Duel Links be the platform for them in addition to speed duels since it means you must now split your already terrible gem economy between the 2 formats(although during my playtime it was obvious which was better to invest into so I just spent everything I had into Rush). Rush Duels at this moment only have 5 boxes and only a few characters you would need to grind through which you will naturally do whilst playing and learning this format, almost every issue I currently have with speed duel DL is not a thing here in Rush but in a few years I can easily see DL Rush struggling from the same thing as Speed.

In conclusion, play Duel Links if you want to experience the only official way to play Rush Duels outside of the OCG but do not play it for its terrible Speed Duels economy.

author: {'steamid': '76561199472547742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 149, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1711327397}
review:
The content itself is virtually non-existent compared to the deck building and to-do lists/ sign in bonuses. The entire thing is massively centered around mobile game gacha-style microtransactions. Also it is dumb to give every new player a ton of gems just so they can screw it up before they know what the meta is. I was moderately entertained for about 12 hours, but it wore off and now it feels rather empty.

The card selection is so overwhelming, but everyone and their grandma will have tons of "ultra-rare" cards. Matchmaking is totally all over the place. It doesn't feel like there's any real sense of progression through any story lines or narratives, and I don't know. I've played better gacha games on my phone. This just didn't feel rewarding to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278007094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 254934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7574, 'playtime_at_review': 247359, 'last_played': 1712504496}
review:
Slowly evolving game like SUPER slow, skills that lock you into mostly anime styled deck its been getting a little bit better with the skills but still wayyy to focused on anime themed decks. 

ALSO, older boxes are still too expensive at 50 gems and the only time the are marked down is when there is a KC cup that happens. 

Another thing that really needs to be done is making the friends list much MUCH larger.

Gate duels are NOT automatic UNLESS there is a new character event other than that it takes too much of my time or others just to get higher level.

Dueling events get stale after time to time (This also includes using same past events being rolled back but with slight changes to them).

Card pool being small or locked behind either from:
1: A skill that can only be used after making sure you go through some long lengthy complex text just to use it
2: Spend 1000 or 500 gems only on 1 structure deck which will become old and not useful in the future
3: Older boxes as mentioned earlier being 50 gems just like newer box(s) being the same price
4: Unlocking a character going through a lot of trouble to get the skill to then use it but be heavily restricted
5: You just end up paying money to go into a box / structure deck

Gold is probably your worst currency that doesn't do anything over time except get you cards from the card trader and NO you CANNOT trade cards with OTHER PLAYERS.

At least give us the option to get mats and sleeves or even cards in a gold foil or new animations using gold or something otherwise its just garbage.

Gems are still hard to get even though it seems like you are getting more, why? Well Rush duels which imo was ruined due to skills.. anyways Rush cards are also 50 gems per pack which of course are 3 cards which is basically like opening a tcg tournament pack.

Mats are locked behind gems / money although you have to spend quite a bit to get mats / sleeves and I really don't like how there is a duel links logo imprinted onto most of them, kinda sucks.

Also no animated sleeves and that the selection of mats and sleeves are extremely limited like come on they are just art work / images it shouldn't be that hard to add more to the game.

Icons are also really reallyyy limited not much to do with them, infact there is a icon for how many prismatics you obtain but again non of them are animated or have any relevance to the game you ALSO cannot buy any icons so again gold is just wasted.

Older animations when summoning monsters are outdated and need to be made to look better, knowing konami they will just ignore it.

The game is labeled also as an JRPG although everyone just skips the stories as they are irrelevant to the actual game play.

Ranked can be fun at times but the way the game is designed due to the card pool being limited and skills not getting any buffs or nerfs INCLUDING OLDER SKILLS the game feels really samey 

Casual is just filled with mostly github bots with beat down / self otk decks not fun / worth anyones time.

Getting gems requires too much time and effort to go through just to get like maybe 5 or so?

Checking the over world every 7 hours every days feels redundant just to get 1-3 random gems like why even add an over world that isn't really that interactive or makes the game play even feel fun?

Music feels repetitive and of COURSE the background changes and music are locked behind $ rather than being able to use in game gold / gems preferably gold unlike master duel where you can just spend gems to change your deck box, sleeves, and mat / battle field.

Not enough character lines feels extremely limiting.

Not enough extra deck room as the game now has more link, synchro, xyz, and fusion monsters alike but knowing konami they will lock this kind of thing behind a skill with massive restrictions.

UI needs more updates and rarely even ever changes like I want to be able to change the color of mine but of course if they did let us do that it will either be locked behind $ or gems not coins because everyone knows coins are just TOO GOOD.

Auto building is just one of the worst non well designed features this also can include auto dueling as I have seen many many many mistakes that the AI will actually try to do to accomplish a simple task that it miserably fails to do.

Search options feel limiting when it comes to cards that makes it extremely annoying to find cards you want to build / play with.

Older cards from different formats are not even in the game which is annoying, but of course they are doing this as it is a gacha game for money rather than its community as a whole.

Speaking of formats I wish there was formats you could play but the only time you can kind of do that is legacy duels but of course oddly and weirdly they change it all the time for the card pool unless you make a custom duel room which has limited options.

Duel rooms need more custom options that the game just lacks to actknowledge.
Being able to favorite cards is amazing but of course there is a limit to it.

Duel turns only last 50 turns which I find to be a bit weird and should last much longer.

Sometimes skills are just too powerful leading to odd rulings that make no sense like for example you cannot book of moon a card that someone activated a skill to summon a monster with which should be better explained in some cases I have lost duels due to dumb rulings like this, burn decks are an amazing example of this like chain reaction burning you when you could have prevented the damage with card but oh well its skill links the video game.

Older skills are not getting buffed, I would also like to say that there are just too many skills in general.

ONE MASSIVE ANNOYING THING TO MENTION: Every time you LOAD THE GAME.. BOOM a pop up.

Anyways, this is just my opinion but I do feel like this should be mentioned as I have been playing for a long time!
Hope this helps some people out.

At this point just point to the sky and pray a archetype gets a skill that locks you into some type or amount of cards in deck or extra deck or amount of type of card or life point value, I would almost argue there will be a skill for how many duels you have won.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055684533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3588, 'last_played': 1711286110}
review:
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links is an iconic card  game with a rich background and huge potential for the mobile scene , on the pc and steam Master Duel is more popular and a better choice but not for everyone and let me explain why its my favourite Yu-Gi-Oh game.

Duel Links" boasts an extensive collection of cards spanning various generations of the Yu-Gi-Oh! series. If you watched the anime shows in the past you'll like this a lot. With a reduced deck format of 20 to 30 cards and 3 monster and 3 spell zones this is the perfect game to learn the rules and mechanics Yu-Gi-Oh has to offer! Because of the simplified format it's also easy to understand each deck strategy. 

Visually, "Duel Links" impresses with its detailed card artwork and character models. The game faithfully recreates the aesthetics of the Yu-Gi-Oh! The user interface is intuitive and well-designed, providing easy access to deck management, card collection, and dueling options.

The game offers a variety of single-player modes, including the campaign, where players duel against iconic characters from the Yu-Gi-Oh! series. These duels follow the anime's storyline and provide a nostalgic experience.

The game has a decent community of players and it offers events, tournaments, and regular updates. These events often introduce new cards, game modes, and rewards.

And because this is a game made by Konami with a ,,free to play'' business model players can spend huge amounts of money to keep up with the meta and stay relevant on the pvp side of the game. From time to time you can build a f2p deck and do well in ladders and tournaments with it but most of the time the meta decks will win every time. 
Be prepared for a grindy experience,this game can be addictive and if you play it on mobile it will drain your battery life like a vampire.

From my experience i have played this game for many years on mobile and you can do well without spending real money, so if you look for a yu gi oh game this might be the best choice for the nostalgic fans and begginers to the Yu-gi-oh universe too.

I recommend this but first my advice is to watch at least the first seasons of the anime if you haven't. It's time to duel !!

Pros
-huge character rooster each with his own voice acting/deck theme and mini stories.
-huge amount of card collection 
-simplified gameplay 
-voice acting 
-faithful recreation of cards , characters and stories from the anime

Cons
-Grindy
-Can be expensive to stay relevant on pvp but it's up to you

My review scores
Story : 9 ( the mini stories from events and character narrative are pretty good for this genre of game)
Graphics : 8
Gameplay : 10
Sound : 9
Overall : 9 Solid choice for a card trading game, especially on mobile but decent on pc too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096687920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 56820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56631, 'last_played': 1711152790}
review:
tl;dr: Recommended for Rush Duel (RD). Not recommended for Speed Duel (SD).

For those who don't know the difference between RD, SD and TCG / MD (original Yu-Gi-Oh, for example Master Duel, separate game):

- SD is the original Duel Links (DL) format. 3 Monster Zones, 3 Spell / Trap Zones, and 1 Extra Monster Zone. Only Main Phase 1 exists (DP -> SP -> MP1 -> BP -> EP, no MP2). 

In the first 2 years of the game, hand traps and graveyard effects were rare, OTK / FTK was meta and duels were quite fast given that we had only up to basic synchro monsters. With the introduction / support of heavy-hitting archetypes like Blue Eyes back in 2019 this meta has shifted from quick duels to cycle-through-your-entire-deck-turn-1 (or 2) into OTK while negating anything your enemy throws at you, kinda like MD, just with some less card space.

FF to 2024, nothing changed, other than having Link, Pendulum and Xyz summons, so even more first turn cycling. Turns take so long you might aswell just play regular Yu-Gi-Oh or MD at this point. It is, however, incredibly strategic, assuming you get to play.

- RD plays very much like season 1 Anime Yu-Gi-Oh but only because there are like 3 boosters and 4 structure decks at the moment which means almost no crap, but also no tactical depth. It's very vanilla-esque Yu-Gi-Oh. Play monster with big ATK, deal big dmg, enemy goes brrr.

 RD has an entirely separate card pool. Main differences between RD and SD are:
* Infinite Normal Summons in MP1 instead of 1.
* Maximum Summon: Literally Power Rangers assemble, 3 monster cards treated as 1. Think of it like Anime Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon, occupying 3 monster slots, OP ATK, OP effects.
* Draw until you have 5 cards in your hand during DP (or 1 if more than 5 already).

That said, if you're completely new to the game, the gacha ain't so stingy (semi-transparent pulls, no 50:50 crap, limited garbage pulls, reset box whenever you want), the "battle pass" is completely optional and with 7 years of content to grind through you'll have plenty of stuff to do. However once (or more like if) you've played through the whole content gems income becomes pretty stale. Enough to keep playing but not enough to switch to a completely different archetype within a reasonable amount of time. Then again due to the nature of Yu-Gi-Oh you need at most 3 copies of a card and not 7, and often times you'll be able to skip entire boxes with the free stuff that gets handed out frequently.

tl;dr Play for Rush Duel as long as RD ain't as stall as Speed Duel. If you like SD more, honestly just play Master Duel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198918347280', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2335, 'last_played': 1688633548}
review:
“Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links” представляет собой увлекательную карточную игру, которая привлекает как новичков, так и опытных игроков. Сокращение некоторых элементов игры делает её более доступной и позволяет быстрее достигать результатов. Новый формат Speed Duel значительно ускоряет дуэли, делая их идеальными для мобильных устройств.
Игра отличается превосходной презентацией, включая полное озвучивание персонажей оригинальными актёрами, что добавляет ностальгии и погружения в мир "Yu-Gi-Oh!". Несмотря на некоторую предсказуемость компьютерного противника и моменты повышенной сложности, эти аспекты не умаляют общего впечатления от игры.
В целом, “Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links” является отличным способом как для возвращения к истокам серии, так и для знакомства с механиками игры для новых игроков. Игра постоянно обновляется, предлагая новые карты и события, что делает игровой процесс разнообразным и интересным

review: I literally spent all day at amazon auto battling ai to grind out cards and climbing the ranked ladder for two and a half years consistently. This game bangs and it brings all those good ol yugioh memories. There's more of the anime side of yugioh here then in master duel and that's a big reason to give this one a try as well. It's a much faster more consistent format, that still manages to be more laid back then the modern yugioh landscape, I'd highly recommend this if you enjoy yugioh <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198045927209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 49, 'playtime_at_review': 2454, 'last_played': 1711505218}
review:
Consistently has connection issues, wont allow reconnection or reboot. The game is basically a terrible port of the mobile version to attempt to cash in on a secondary market, without doing any of the actual work to validate it to the player base.
You cant even rewatch duels people send you links for because they only load in the phone app version, it just forwards you to a page to download the mobile app (while on desktop, which makes no sense).

It really isn't that hard to do the bare minimum to justify it to the PC player base with how much money all the microtransactions must be raking in.

review: Very fun game if you're looking to take a trip to the past and experience some Yugioh. I really enjoy how you can switch between worlds that way i can keep playing the older original version of yugioh and not the tech and all these linked cards. I really enjoy this game and its not too sweaty, and they give you a lot of stuff for free! There is also a mobile version! 10/10 recommend for any Yugioh player, if you want to get to know what it is, or just a tcg player in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198826150156', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3509, 'playtime_at_review': 9579, 'last_played': 1712063043}
review:
以前國小時都把零用錢+壓歲錢拿去組戰士族的排組，至少也花了一兩萬，假日一定會去家裡附近的文具店，跟路人決鬥，賭銀製的卡片，然後國中偷帶去學校玩，結果全被同學偷走，那時也傻不敢跟老師講，就這樣全沒了，很多金閃銀閃浮雕的卡片，現在賣應該很值錢，感謝這個遊戲可以重溫我國小的夢想，對戰方便多了，不用看效果看半天，系統自己會判斷，很多都免費很讚!

遊戲內容豐富的超乎想像，玩法多元，更新快速，獎勵豐厚，基本上不課金就玩不完，課金也未必能抽到一定要的牌，這是個很好的平衡，不小心玩了整天，要小心。

author: {'steamid': '76561198035857536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 65973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5194, 'playtime_at_review': 59984, 'last_played': 1712504146}
review:
My only criticism is that Little Kuriboh has not been consulted for the abridged story pieces that are told during events.*

It's F2P so you can grease the wheel by buying cards but once you hit a certain groove - especially during events - you'll be able to get cards for the latest meta decks. And since you start as Seto Kaiba (choice? nah) I was able to get a load of Blue-Eyes cards and try out my new favourite decks: Lunalight and Trickstar. 

Not an extensive review, no, but this I can say: when I played Hearthstone I had to focus on only one class and destroy old cards to get the newest ones. I can easily play multiple characters here since all the cards are shared but I also find myself accumulating more and more cards from packs and events that I now play multiple characters in each generation and never even consider crippling that archetype to try another.

*alright, the navigation does suck because it's a mobile port and the lag during PvP duels can be horrendous

author: {'steamid': '76561198942555824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1167, 'playtime_at_review': 11741, 'last_played': 1712081182}
review:
Leider meiner Meinung nach immer noch das beste Yu-Gi-Oh Spiel auf dem Markt.
Das Spiel bietet massig Content jeglicher Art. Im Gegensatz zu Master Duel ist Duel Links auch sehr "verbunden" mit dem Anime. (Spielbare Charaktere, Fähigkeiten dieser Charaktere, etc.)
Ein weiterer Punkt der für dieses Spiel, zu mindest jetzt noch, spricht ist, dass die Meta sich überhaupt nicht ähnelt mit dem TCG oder Master Duel, was ich auch ziemlich angenehm finde.
Leider, weil das Spiel oft ziemlich grindy sein kann und auch ein wenig pay to win ist. Zwar kann man auch gut ohne Geld auszugeben das Spiel spielen, kann sich aber dann meistens nicht die neusten und besten Decks leisten. Dies würde sich teilweise durch den einzigen Vorteil, den Master Duel hat, lösen. Nämlich das Karten Crafting System, was in Duel Links leider noch nicht existiert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111811875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 38816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38816, 'last_played': 1562517773}
review: This is, in my opinion, the best yugioh card game online. The speed duel format was a great thing to introduce for the game. Modern yugioh is way too combo-centric which just leads to a un-fun, time-wasting gameplay loop that is rarely rewarding even when you win. Links on the other hand is a great way to play the game and build decks in the flavor of yugioh without it having to be absurd. My only complaint is that there is pve matches, but they're limited. You only get a certain number per day, which i find really strange. In the end I prefer legacy of the duelist for more solo content, but this one is definitely worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561199563617673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1708908931}
review:
I've been playing Duel Links for 6-7 years and couldn't transfer my data, but starting over isn't too bad. I enjoy this game a lot for its simplicity in PVP, and facing some legendary duelists is very cool. I tried another version of the game, Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel, but I felt it was too competitive for me. I came back instantly to Duel Links for its casual gameplay, not for the competitive aspect of the game.

I have been watching the Yu-Gi-Oh! anime, and I started loving Joey's duels surprisingly over Kaiba, who I used to play in my old account, specifically his warrior decks and Red-Eyes, which I am going for. For warriors, I've been building a Six Samurai deck and more, but I think I'll be trying different characters I didn't get a chance to before. I'll probably go up to Pendulum because I felt it's too complicated compared to the other stuff that came out recently. Maybe it's just me, but I feel like the simplicity of the anime was taken out, and now you have to think a lot more for these duels. Maybe I'll change my mind, but who knows.

review: Extremamente Pay to win, quem não pode por dinheiro no jogo fica a merce de ficar recebendo migalhas de gemas em 99% dos eventos, tem que guardar todas tuas gemas pra abrir um único pacote pra montar um deck que preste, pra poder jogar pvp, sendo que daqui a pouco teu deck vai ser nerfado pq até que põe dinheiro no jogo vai montar, vai virar um deck abusivo e vai tomar banlist, ou resumindo... Teu deck vai ficar injogável e tu vai ter que esperar lançar uma box que valha a pena abrir de novo.

review:
This game is very fun to play, even as a Free To Play player.
You can get a lot of items from events and all that stuff, which already gives you a boost.
I never actually had the feeling i actually had to use real money in this game.
This game is also better for casual players and people who only watched the anime or read the manga.
If you already play yu gi oh regularly you should play Master Duel too.
TLDR: Fun game, not really pay 2 win, if you already played yu gi oh before play master duel instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561199108407462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 60251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2098, 'playtime_at_review': 51252, 'last_played': 1712494919}
review:
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links
É um jogo divertido
E tem muitos personagens (bom a maioria que aparece no anime), e gostei que eles tem habilidades únicas
As musicas são ótimas, principalmente quando estamos vencendo em um duelo ou perdendo
O sistema de compra de cartas é . . . bem . . .
Tem decks que você não consegue todas as cartas no free to play, como cartas de estruturais por poder pegar uma vez os estruturais com a moeda do jogo, ou você paga para pegar as cartas que você precisa ou você espera aparecer algum evento que de "Bilhetes dos Sonhos" SR ou UR que precisa
Mas isso a gente releva por o jogo ser de graça
A eu queria falar que as cartas com o efeito prismático não são tao bonitas assim não, eu prefiro o efeito prismático do Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel que lá é muito lindo
Mas isso é só um detalhe bobo que eu não gostei mesmo
O jogo está legendado para o Português, só ai o jogo ganha mais um ponto comigo
Você também pode vincular a sua conta com a conta Konami e assim poder jogar no celular e no Computador
De resto o jogo é muito bom

Ah Konami
Coloca a Camula de Yu-Gi-Oh! GX e adiciona a armadilha "Controle do Vampiro" ou mais cartas de vampiro

author: {'steamid': '76561198004224106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1532491331}
review: I play this game on mobile and can honestly say this game is completely p2w. The overpowered cards introduced by komoney are so strong that most of the time the f2p player will not even be able to play more than a single round before losing. I stick to pve, even that game mode is completely barebones you can only play couple of matches before running out of people to duel and keys for the gate. IMO everything other kind of summoning after ritual introduced by komoney is complete trash and I feel like I should be able to filter that unnecessary content out of the game if I choose. This game has no crafting system, no card trading and it is also laggy and buggy.

review:
joguei um poko quando lançou, parei por um tempo, tentei voltar, e simplesmente tinha perdido minha conta, ai desanimei pois tinha ganho vários treco por ser jogador de lançamento e ja tava com um progressinho ok... ns se um dia volto, mas esse yu gi oh é diferente dos outros, ele é feito pra ter batalhas mais curtas e tal pois tem metade da vida e espaço de tabuleiro se nao me engano, o foda do yu gi oh, é que cada poucos anos eles lançam um novo ai tu tem que investir ou tempo ou grana de novo pra ter o que tu ja tinha antes.... simplesmente não faz sentido jogar qualquer outro jogo de yu gi oh que não seja esse que tem mecanicas diferentes pois os outros em questão de tempo estarao obsoletos e ninguem ou quase ninguém ira jogar mais.....

ent ne acho que n recomendo

review: Insane lack of Q&A on this game. Skills are constantly mistranslated and very often use different wording between them. Balancing is currently a huge mess as Skills tend to overperform and get undernerfed - at time of writing, we're in a Tier 0 format because one such Skill created a deck that is hyper consistent and difficult to interact with. Not worth playing in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561199009012380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 166393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1516, 'playtime_at_review': 158614, 'last_played': 1712355192}
review: it may be harder for new players....but it's still an amazing game, it's hard not to be unbiased since i've been playing since the 3rd or 2nd anniversary and since then the game has got more and more complex, so for new players, be prepared to lose a lot. but when you win, know that it is a feat you should be proud of. and if you're not a new player...please stop with the negate fields, yeah it's a good strat, but it is miserable to fight against, let the opponent have fun too even if you intend to crush them, let them at least play for a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112842009', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 13428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9805, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1712504386}
review: Confesso que foi o primeiro Yu-Gi-Oh! que joguei pra valer. Antes havia me aventurado no de PS2. Para quem é fã da franquia e também da modalidade o game entrega muito conteúdo. Por ser uma versão no estilo mobilie, o game as vezes fica bem "chato" por conta do volume de propagandas, animações e ofertas que ficam spamando na tela o tempo todo. Mas nada que alguns bons cliques acabem com isso e você volte para a pancadaria. Recomendado para fãs de Magic ou card games em geral.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008635322', 'num_games_owned': 2696, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 7203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7203, 'last_played': 1656692951}
review:
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links brings the popular trading card game (TCG) to the digital realm, offering fans and newcomers alike a platform to engage in fast-paced duels that capture the essence of the original card game. Developed by Konami, Duel Links simplifies the traditional Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG format for mobile and PC platforms, making it accessible while still retaining strategic depth. This review assesses the game's core aspects, including gameplay mechanics, card collection, competitive scene, graphics and presentation, and community and support, to provide a comprehensive look at its offerings.

1. Gameplay Mechanics
Rating: 8/10 - Good
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links streamlines the classic TCG gameplay, reducing the size of the playing field and deck, which leads to quicker and more dynamic duels. This adaptation preserves the strategic complexity that fans appreciate, requiring careful deck construction and tactical play. The game introduces a "Skill" system, unique abilities tied to each duelist that can turn the tide of battle, adding an extra layer of strategy. However, the simplified format might not appeal to purists seeking the full TCG experience.

2. Card Collection
Rating: 7/10 - Good
The heart of any TCG is its card collection, and Duel Links offers a vast array of cards from the Yu-Gi-Oh! universe. Players can acquire cards through gameplay, purchasing packs, or participating in events. While the game is generous in awarding cards and in-game currency to new players, progressing and obtaining specific cards or building competitive decks can feel grindy or push towards microtransactions. Despite this, the thrill of collecting, trading, and strategizing with cards is well-presented.

3. Competitive Scene
Rating: 8/10 - High
Duel Links boasts a vibrant competitive scene, from casual matches to ranked duels and global tournaments. The ranking system is well-structured, offering players a clear path to progress and compete at higher levels. Seasonal events and tournaments keep the competitive landscape fresh, though balancing issues and meta dominance by specific decks can sometimes dampen the diversity of competitive play.

4. Graphics and Presentation
Rating: 9/10 - Excellent
Konami has done an excellent job in the graphics and presentation department, bringing the Yu-Gi-Oh! world to life with vibrant visuals and animations. The character models and card illustrations are faithful to the source material, and the battle animations add excitement to the duels. The user interface is intuitive, making navigation and deck management a smooth process. The attention to detail in recreating iconic locations and characters from the Yu-Gi-Oh! series enhances the overall experience.

5. Community and Support
Rating: 7/10 - Good
The Duel Links community is active and engaged, with forums, social media groups, and in-game chat features fostering a sense of camaraderie among players. Konami regularly updates the game with new content, fixes, and balance adjustments, showing a commitment to maintaining a healthy gaming environment. However, feedback on balance changes and microtransaction practices can be mixed, with some players expressing concerns over pay-to-win aspects.

6. Microtransactions, In-Game Purchases, and Pay-to-Win Mechanism
Rating: 6/10 - Fair

Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links employs a microtransaction system that allows players to purchase card packs, unlock characters, and speed up progress through in-game purchases. While the game provides a decent amount of content accessible through gameplay alone, the reliance on microtransactions to obtain specific cards or to compete effectively in higher-tier competitive play introduces a pay-to-win aspect that can be a point of contention.

The game's monetization strategy, while not overly aggressive compared to some mobile games, can still create a significant divide between paying and non-paying players, especially in the competitive scene. Players who invest money have a noticeable advantage in terms of acquiring powerful cards and building optimized decks more quickly than those who don’t. This system can lead to frustration among the player base, particularly for those who wish to remain competitive without spending money.

Konami has made efforts to mitigate these concerns by offering free card packs, in-game currency, and rewards through daily logins, events, and challenges. These initiatives help to some extent but do not entirely eliminate the advantages gained through in-game purchases. The balance between rewarding gameplay and incentivizing purchases is delicate, and while Duel Links navigates this landscape better than many mobile games, there is still room for improvement to ensure a fairer competitive environment for all players.

With the inclusion of microtransactions, in-game purchases, and the pay-to-win mechanism as a criterion, Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links maintains its status as an engaging and accessible digital TCG experience but faces additional scrutiny over its monetization practices. While the game excels in gameplay mechanics, competitive scene, and presentation, the impact of microtransactions on competitive balance and player experience cannot be overlooked.

Overall Rating: 7.6/10 - Good for those can afford pay-to-win mechanism

review: O jogo é divertido e viciante. Para quem é fã de longa data é um jogo perfeito para se jogar. Porém nem tudo é maravilha, quedas contantes da conexão mesmo tendo internet boa e o jogo deixou de ser estratégico e está bastante desbalanceado, pq tem jogadores que tem uns decks que em uma rodada só invoca mais de 10 cartas monstros e quando termina está com 4 monstros de mais de 2500-3000 de ataque. A partida acaba terminando em apenas 2 turnos.

review:
A game from my childhood that is still enjoyable to play today.
New characters, quests and just having a good time.

Advice to all those who just started the game - buy one or two structured decks and develop them - so you will have several playing decks. If you complete quests and enter the game from time to time, you will have enough game currency.

review:
Played Yu-Gi-Oh for about 15 years. Loved this game, still do. Brought a new lease of life for the card game to me. Thankfully i haven't activated my trap card "credit card"... too much. 
For a free game it is really fun, but if you want to get all of the achievements it really is an unnecessary grind, and covered in heavy RNG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340788460', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 262, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1711990060}
review:
RUSH DUELS!!!

Don't like Yugioh? Download anyway. The new update adds "Rush duels" which is a revolutionary new game mode that makes Yugioh fun again. Gone are the days of busted card archetypes, insta win 1 turn combos, pendulums, synchros, xyz's or even fusions. It's just you, your normal and effect monsters, some spells, traps and a feeling of rediscovering your childhood. 
It feels like classic yugioh, I.e. the anime where you and your opponent go back and forth, smashing each other monsters and strategize to widdle down their life points. There's never a feeling of hopelessness and there's always a window to come back from the lowest point. 
Speaking of anime, go watch Yugioh sevens and thank IT for this revolutionary new game mode. Yugioh's FUN AGAIN, BABY!

author: {'steamid': '76561199030437010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 75609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 244, 'playtime_at_review': 71692, 'last_played': 1712453561}
review: Para quem gosta dos animes ou apenas de alguns mesmo, este jogo é muito legal, visto que o jogo possui as dublagens em inglês, japonês e Coreano dos principais personagens que apareceram nos respectivos animes, claro que seria muito melhor se tivesse a dublagem em português por causa da nostalgia, mas enquanto não chega, aproveitemos o que têm disponível, mas o lado negativo é que infelizmente não dá ânimo de jogar na ranqueada por ter muitos jogadores extremamente viciados no jogo e ter que esperar 5 ou mais minutos até eles terminarem os seus combos e te derrotar de OTK (One Turn Kill) e negar todos os efeitos das cartas que você usa. Sou um jogador mais play for fun e me divirto nos portões de personagens lendários que o jogo oferece, fazendo vários confrontos que aconteceram no anime, mas com cards novos do arquétipo daquele personagem. No geral é um 4/5 estrelas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380565267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1705725424}
review:
Quite good game with some interesting events and characters' selection. The special abilities each character may use gives an additional strategic and tactical difficulty.

The only suggestion I do about it would be about the updates and installment packages when having the game already installed. It would be nice that Steam sends notifications about its updates or bug fix patches, so it could be installed using Steam UI Interface, and not only when trying to launch the game - I had close to 1400 packages pending to be downloaded, because I haven't played it since 2020.

author: {'steamid': '76561199232687480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1705512755}
review:
===Gráficos===
⬜ 140p
◽ Nintendo Ds
🔲Aceitável
✅Bom
◽ Ótimo
🔲Perfeito

===Requisitos==
🔲Uma torradeira com uma pilha
🔲Um celular
✅Um i5 com uma GTX 750TI
◽ Pc com CPU e GPU muito boas
⬜ Pc da NASA

===História===
⬜ historia? que historia?
✅Uma história bacana
◽ Uma história digna
⬜Sequência de jogo

===Jogabilidade===
✅Precisa de dois dedos pra jogar
⬜ Aceitável (4 dedos pra ser específico)
◽ Jogabilidade bacana
🔲Jogabilidade excelente

===Complexidade===
⬜Facil de entender
🔲Fácil de aprender, difícil de dominar
✅É daqueles jogos que as pessoas ficam estudando
🔲Precisa de, no mínimo, 2 doutorados

===Dificuldade===
⬜ Seu cachorro consegue
🔲Da pra zerar com uma batata de controle
🔲Fácil
✅Médio
🔲Quase Mineirinho
🔲Dark Souls
🔲Você precisa de reflexos instantâneos e 4 mãos

===Tempo de jogo (todas as conquistas)===
 ⬜2h (para nao pedir remboso kkkkk)
◽ 6h
🔲12h
🔲24h
🔲48h
✅100h+

===Trilha sonora===
🔲Beep
🔲É melhor jogar no mudo
✅ Aceitável e legalzinha
⬜ Perfeita

===Bugs===
🔲Nunca vi nenhum
✅Pequenos bugs
🔲Pode ficar irritante
🔲Pode estragar a gameplay
⬜ Comprei bug e veio um jogo nele


===Publico===
⬜Crianças
⬜Adolescentes
◽ Adultos
✅Tudo e todos

===Compensa Comprar? ===
✅IT'S FREE
🔲Preço justo
🔲Compre se tiver dinheiro sobrando
🔲Espere uma promoção
⬜ Caro demais não recomendo

author: {'steamid': '76561198064929410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1673997550}
review: The game itself is fun to play but I do wish they had more game modes such as a classic, no link, no synchro, no etc etc modes... sometimes I just surrender instead of waiting 30 minutes for someone to finish their never ending summoning strategy

author: {'steamid': '76561198864611386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6784, 'last_played': 1638060461}
review: Es un buen juego hasta cierto punto, para poder darle pelea a los que escalan rápido en rankeds si o si tienes que meterle dinero y es casi imposible hacerlo con cartas free como antes. Pero si quieres pasar un rato con la experiencia de Yu-Gi-Oh! este es un buen juego para entretenerte con los eventos.

review: O jogo inicia com excelente proposta, cativando com gráficos impressionantes e jogabilidade envolvente. No entanto, à medida que avança, a repetição emerge como um problema, deixando a experiência menos divertida com o passar do tempo. Apesar disso, o jogo ainda proporciona momentos de diversão e é uma opção válida para os entusiastas do gênero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819125024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1706208110}
review: 其實我不討厭這遊戲，但是玩這遊戲要煩惱的事情太多了，多到光思考就會讓人精神衰弱的那種。不過呢，不得不說官方在週年慶祝等活動上送給玩家的東西還是蠻多的，可以說比其他遊戲大方不少，贈送的禮物內容也看得出來有根據時下玩家的需求在變化，但這始終只能稍微減輕前面提到的...那種會讓人感到偏頭痛的感觸，這遊戲我就偶爾回來看一下，不過只是享受擁有這些卡片的感覺而已...要拚比賽還是幹嘛的，終究還是太累了。

review: Is it possible to build a solid deck and win consecutively for free? Yes. Will you do It? No. Duel Links is a cash grab P2W deck builder with never ending meta changes. You'll definitely want to pick this game up if you're looking to compensate for what you do lack in life outside of disability money. Friends, Relationships, Mostly showers though.

author: {'steamid': '76561199153232841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1707797842}
review: The game is super fun, offline play is great for new players. This game feels like an "on the quicks" type of game because play mat is limited to 3 cards and an extra for extra deck/pendulum cards. I recommend this game to NEW PLAYERS. Online against people really sucks too because EVERY SINGLE person has the same super OP deck. There is no variety at all and if my cards don't line up well enough, then I lose within 5 turns. I love that I was able to create my personal deck in the game, missing a bunch of the cards, but its ok for what it is.

review:
if you wanna play yugioh online, just download a simulator that doesn't cost money and play with friends. if you wanna buy yugioh stuff than buy actual physical merchandise like cards. if you want to use your physical cards in online play than invest in a camera+desk set-up.

this game's a lot of fun but don't spend any money on it.

review: Eu gosto do jogo, pois diferente do master duel, os duelos são bem mais divertidos e interessante pela presença dos personagens dos animes de YU gi oh, porém ele não recompensa muito quem joga a muito tempo, você não vai ter pelo menos os decks que você quer, principalmente quem só tem 100 horas de jogo e se caso um dos seus decks pegar ban list, você só vai ter prejuízo na conta, não recomendo

review: Si vous aimez Yu-Gi-Oh ne jouez pas ce jeu n'est là que pour faire du harcèlement déjà commencer est impossible n'espérez pas gagner avant une centaine de match et n'espérez pas non plus vous créer un deck imaginé de toutes pièces non ici tout le monde joue des decks préfaits peu importe le rang ou vous êtes globalement c'est une perte de temps absolument colossale

author: {'steamid': '76561198015824375', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 3680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2707, 'last_played': 1704880680}
review:
Feels more like "mini yu-gi oh" field size is 3x2 so very limited on what combos to do. In addition to the very frequent DC or network error the game gives

Pros:
+ Free
+ Simple to learn

Cons:
- 3x2 field insted of proper yu-gi-oh field
- DC errors
- Perma commercials before you get to any game to buy different stuff

author: {'steamid': '76561199050583841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19972, 'last_played': 1707887833}
review: Bien conocido por ser el sueño lucido de Kaiba, aun que gira en torno a las cajas me parece que el balanceo de entre el precio y la dificultadad de conseguir las gemas se ve equilibrado, lo que si no veo algún punto es el hecho de poner estructuras especiales a precio fuera de los jugadores free to play, aunque mas tarde estas puedan salir en cajas, pero en su mayoria no resulta en si, de por si el juego es bastante entretenido si has visto el anime en la infancia o te gustan juegos de este estilo, tal vez los eventos si sean muy repetitivos, pero puede ser que no consideren primordialmente esos aspectos, deberian ver el potencial que tienen en eso.

review: While I don't enjoy the PvP players who play decks designed to win within the first two turns of the match, I will say that the game outside of that small area is extremely fun. It is very grindy and have a lot of p2w mechanics (its literally a mobile gacha game, if you hate the game for that reason, you're gonna find p2w in a mobile gacha game), but the duels always feel fun to test out your deck as you gain more cards to your arsenal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077961946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5441, 'last_played': 1702998011}
review: So I'm from the good 'ol Yu-Gi-Oh! time with Yugi and Kaiba etc. The dialogues between such characters is fun but they added A LOT to the game since the first series. I can't keep up with things like XYZ summons or pendulum whatever and I notice I"m not motivated to learn about such things. Resulting in me using classic cards which I like and find fun to use but are crap in PvP duels where everyone summons like 10 different things in their first turn and make all my cards inert. Which takes away a lot of the fun for me. A filter would be great in which you can choose to battle others with just the classic rules but they dont offer such a thing.  I cant recommend this for these reasons (please there are three blue eyes white dragons which are rare enough as it is, not endless blue eyes whatever dragons with weird effects and endless special summons).

author: {'steamid': '76561198146353351', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1710359699}
review:
[h1]Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links - Duelos de Cartas Épicos no Mundo de Yu-Gi-Oh![/h1]

[b]Avaliação do Jogo: Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links[/b]

Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links oferece uma experiência envolvente de duelos de cartas, trazendo o emocionante mundo de Yu-Gi-Oh! para dispositivos móveis e plataformas. Nesta avaliação, exploraremos os elementos que tornam Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links uma escolha cativante para os fãs do universo Yu-Gi-Oh!.

[b]Duelos Estratégicos e Desafiadores[/b]
A mecânica central do jogo gira em torno de duelos estratégicos entre jogadores, onde a escolha das cartas, posicionamento e timing são cruciais. A profundidade estratégica e a variedade de decks disponíveis garantem uma experiência desafiadora.

[b]Coleção de Cartas Extensa[/b]
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links apresenta uma coleção extensa de cartas, permitindo que os jogadores construam decks personalizados com base em suas estratégias preferidas. A constante adição de novas cartas através de atualizações mantém a coleção dinâmica e empolgante.

[b]História e Personagens do Anime[/b]
O jogo incorpora elementos da história e personagens do anime Yu-Gi-Oh!, proporcionando uma experiência autêntica para os fãs. Os duelos contra personagens icônicos e a narrativa envolvente acrescentam uma camada adicional de imersão.

[b]Eventos Especiais e Atualizações Regulares[/b]
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links oferece eventos especiais regulares, apresentando desafios únicos, recompensas exclusivas e colaborações sazonais. As atualizações frequentes garantem que o jogo permaneça dinâmico, com novos recursos e conteúdos para os jogadores explorarem.

[b]Modos de Jogo Variados[/b]
Além dos duelos PvP (jogador contra jogador), o jogo oferece modos de jogo variados, como missões PvE (jogador contra ambiente), duelos rápidos e torneios. Isso proporciona uma variedade de experiências para os jogadores, independentemente de seu estilo de jogo.

[b]Gráficos e Interface Amigáveis[/b]
Os gráficos de Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links são vibrantes e fiéis à estética do anime. A interface é amigável, facilitando a navegação pelos menus, construção de decks e realização de duelos, mesmo para jogadores iniciantes.

[b]Conclusão[/b]
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links oferece uma experiência cativante para os fãs de Yu-Gi-Oh!, combinando duelos estratégicos, uma coleção vasta de cartas e a presença envolvente dos personagens do anime. Com eventos regulares, atualizações consistentes e modos de jogo variados, Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links é uma escolha recomendada para os amantes do jogo de cartas.

[b]Nota: 9/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561199287780383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9453, 'last_played': 1709763970}
review:
No lo recomiendo, es una mierd@ de juego. Esta lleno de Habilidades de personajes totalmente injustas, las cuales es imposible responder con algo. Habilidades que hacen de todo, no hay que saber ni jugar ni armar un deck, como la Habilidad de Vinculo Eterno de Yubel o Judai, un asco, es simplemente robar una Yubel o Neos y GG, ganaste. Más de un duelo que he jugado y ya tenía ganado, pero el pavo activa la habilidad y me remonta, algo que de normal no pasaría jamás. Usar habilidades es como hacer trampa, man. Te cienta súper mal que un tipo te gane solo por una Skill. Asqueroso.
Además de que el juego ya es igual al TCG, al Master Duel, infumable en resumen. Está lleno de spam invocaciones de invocaciones y mierd@as. Y al final es lo mismo, combo y más combo para llegar a cierto monstro y ya...

author: {'steamid': '76561198451963606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 169073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 390, 'playtime_at_review': 164572, 'last_played': 1712105837}
review:
Been playing this speed duel format of yugioh since February 2017. With almost 3000 hours over nearly 7 years I still log on and can enjoy playing this game. I've seen and played in nearly every meta and have enjoyed and disliked some of those.  There is a long level up grind for free in game resources but recently they are adding in easier cheaper ways to get decks you may want. It's worth checking out if you had/have an interest in yugioh. It is still lower powered compared to tcg/master duel as there are not as many high impact cards yet.

It is now 2 games in 1 with the addition of rush duels into the game for September 2023. You have speed duels, the original main mode and now rush duels which uses a separate card pool and game rules if that mode interests you more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154451961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 109935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1076, 'playtime_at_review': 103674, 'last_played': 1712442266}
review:
I can't believe that I played over 1700 hours of this game.  I was really a huge fan of the original Yu-Gi-Oh! cartoon, I had tried some of the other Yu-Gi-Oh! games prior to this one.  This game better represents the feeling that I had when seeing the original cartoon.  I haven't had the pleasure of learning the manga other than reading about the key differences of it compared to the cartoon series.  Through this game I developed knowledge and in most cases respect for the other later entries of the Yu-Gi-Oh! series.  

I have so much fun with planning out my moves, and trying to execute it against my opponents.  The issues that I have is that as time has gone on, I run into instances when some cards are way too overpowering.  Situations where you may have to go offline to research and find out if and how a card could be beaten.  Imagine if you will, a card that can hit your lifepoints directly; remove or ignore your trap cards and remove your offense and/or defense cards as soon as it is summoned.  How can you plan for something that you do not know even exist?  So, to me sometimes I roll my eyes and discount some matches as it feels too improbable (especially when facing certain AI opponents with red caps.  

The only other thing that I wish was that the music of the cartoon for Yu-Gi-Oh! original series could be implemented for Yugi and Yami Yugi.  Man, I wish they had thought of having the 2 of them dynamically switch and the sound effect/music play, to me that would have been INSANE.!  They did do that for Yuma and Astra (as they touch the sky) which looks so awesome.  They also did something akin to it with Jaden and the Spirit Yubel.  Also, I am not gonna lie, the music score for Jaden when he starts to take over a match, there were times I just stopped playing the match just to keep hearing that music!!!! 

So, bottom line over the many years I've been playing it, I log in and play it every single day that I log in to my pc so that I can get the daily incentives, prizes, and the daily quiz to earn the gift that's awarded.  I get so upset when I have a computer issue that last days as I pride myself on getting consecutive log in days and clearing all of the AI opponents that are presented upon first entering the game.  Been doing it for years.  

Finally, you may have noticed that I have not once talked about the tournaments and playing against various people around the world, that is because I have never had any desire to do so.  I do not particularly care for gaming with complete strangers, just never saw the upside to mingling with various strangers.   Nonetheless, you can see as essentially a single-player gamer I am loving this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198449804769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13285, 'last_played': 1703667366}
review:
Severely unbalanced and very boring.
I made it to Legend Rank 1 with my own deck i.e. a deck I didn't copy and look up tutorials on YouTube.
XYZ/Synchro/Pendulum/Blue Eyes/Magician/Ancient Warriors/Link/La-La decks are ALL you will see. It just doesn't capture the essence of the original YuGiOh anymore.
There is no variety in this game, levelling up is a grind and you do need to pay to win for the most part. A lot of times, you will get taken out on the second turn.

With all these link and XYZ decks, you can watch a movie by the time it takes for an opponent to complete their turn...it's very repetitive seeing cards come and go; especially when they could just reduce your lifepoints to 0. The game is very unforgiving towards original decks.

Play it for the free 3000 gems or so at the start, make a deck, have a few duels and then quit.

Unless the aforementioned decks get nerfed badly, you will lose if you want to play to have fun. To win competitively at this game, you need to have one of the decks above.
I did well with a toon deck, but the new link and ancient warrior cards, along with the XYZ cards all have effects that banish - sometimes multiple cards all at once - leaving you utterly defenceless.

Konami, we know you will keep the game unbalanced for the money and we know the die-hard players will pay for the top decks to dominate, simply because they fail in life.

author: {'steamid': '76561199439342247', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1706735271}
review:
Si queres empezar a jugar Yugioh este juego es ideal para comenzar, aunque puede ser tedioso el aprenderse todos los metodos de invocacion (Ritual, Fusion, Sincronia, Xyz, Pendulo y Link) por lo que recomiendo tomarse el tiempo si realmente estas interesado en jugarlo, igual el juego se hace mas dinamico con las "habilidades" de los personajes, a demas al ser"Speed Duels" los duelos son mas faciles al tener solo 3 casillas de Magias y de Monstruos y una Extra para los Monstruos del Extra Deck  y ahora con la incorporacion de los "Rush Duel" (es otro tipo de duelos que no tiene que ver con los Speed Duel) Son mas faciles ya que solo es invocar monstruos tanto como el puedas y eso le da una nueva forma de ver el juego y tambien es lo mas cercano (hasta el momento) al estilo de juego tradicional y sin tantas Invocaciones locas
En resumen:
¿lo recomiendo? Si, es solo cuestion de paciencia

PD: Se ve que apenes tengo horas el juego pero es por que lo juego en el celular ya que ahi tengo varias horas jugadas y me da pereza esperar a que se descarge todo xd

review:
Eu realmente não sei se é problema com a Steam, hackers ou a Konami não gostar de Brasileiros, provavelmente mais a Konami, mas Duel Links por aqui no PC virou apenas a plataforma para jogar pve, fazer compras e montar decks porque TODO duelo pvp seja Ranked ou contra amigos eu automaticamente perco no turno 1 por "Connection Failed". 

É um jogo bom, e incentivo qualquer um a jogar principalmente pelo modo Rush que é algo que não existe fora do Japão e Coreia fora simuladores não oficiais e um jogo de Nintendo Switch. Porém joguem em plataformas mobile usando dados móveis se são Brasileiros e querem jogar o pvp.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050423505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6847, 'last_played': 1704721208}
review:
Ich habe früher Yu-Gi-Oh! im TV geliebt. Nebst Pokémon und Dragon Ball war es mein Favorit. Im Gegensatz zu Pokémon hatte ich aber nie physische Karten, da in der Schule bei uns einfach Pokémon der Renner war. 

[h3]Spieleinstieg/Spiel:[/h3]
Mehr als 20 Jahre später wagte ich mich also als total Unerfahrener an die Sache heran – ohne grosse Erwartungen und eigentlich nur um in alten Erinnerungen zu schwelgen. Der Einstieg war schwer. Zuerst dachte ich, dass es daran liegt, dass ich mich noch nie damit befasst habe. Irgendwann, auch durch Kommentare und Youtube, wurde mir klar, dass ein Vorwissen nicht ein Vorteil gewesen wäre, vielleicht sogar ein Nachteil. Das Duel Links System ist eine rasantere Spielweise als die klassische Variante. Hinzu kommt, dass sich logischwerweise Yu-Gi-Oh! weiterentwickelt hat. Sicherlich nicht nur, um den Spielern dauerhaft Spannung zu ermöglichen, sondern, um auch das "In Game"-System umfänglich zu bedienen.

Wie in jedem Game, muss man sich auch hier hineinarbeiten. Einen Unterschied sowie eine Gemeinsamkeit mit anderen Games hat Duel Links.
 
Zuerst zum Unterschied: Der Story-Mode bringt einem zwar die grundlegenden Mechanismen bei, lehrt einem aber bei weitem nicht alles Notwendige. Im Story-Mode spielt man meistens auf einem sehr tiefen Niveau. Das mag für den Anfang gut sein, wenn man sich aber schneller weiterentwickelt als die Story, ist man schnell damit unterfordert. Bringt man sich die ganzen Mechanismen aber nicht selber bei, kann einem Anfänger das ganze Spieluniversum extrem kompliziert vorkommen. Klar sagt einem das Spiel, welche Karten man gerade ausspielen kann, oder welcher Effekt oder welche Zauber/Fallenkarte zum Zug kommen kann. Aber der Story-Mode kratzt nur an der Oberfläche. Komplexe Kartendecks werden nicht benutzt. Einerseits macht das Sinn, denn man möchte ja nicht die besten Kartendecks einfach preisgeben, damit jeder ein krasses Set besitzt. Anderseits lernt man dadurch weder die diversen (guten) Karten kennen, noch wie man diese kombiniert und effektiv einsetzt. Vielleicht möchte man damit verhindern, dass Spieler zu leicht erfahren, welches sozusagen Winner-Sets sind. Da man aber ab einem gewissen Level so oder so recherchieren muss, stösst man automatisch im Netzt auf Turnier-Sets, oder zumindest auf gute bis sehr gute Kombinationen.
Ein positiver Unterschied ist, dass wirklich (fast) jeder ein gewisses Level an Professionalität erlangen kann. Bei einem PVP-Shooter muss einem diese Spielart auch in einer gewissen Art auch liegen, sonst ist man häufiger am Respawnen als am Zocken. Dies passiert einem hier nicht, solange man wirklich Zeit in die Zusammenstellung des Decks investiert.

Nun zur Gemeinsamkeit mit anderen Games: in anderen Spielen erhält man in Tutorials und im Story-Mode zwar meistens alles (wichtige) Wissen, ist aber genau so unvorbereitet auf PVP wie bei Yu-Gi-Oh! Denn da spielt man dann sofort auf einem ganz anderen lvl. Man wird sozusagen ins kalte Wasser geworfen und nur durch viel Übung und Recherche besser.

[h3]Deck:[/h3]
Darum handelt der grösste Teil des Games und orientiert sich daran, was man mit dem Spiel erreichen will. Möchte man coole Karten sammeln? Will man möglichst viele Varianten von Decks austesten? Soll das Deck immer aus den neusten Boxen zusammengestellt werden? Oder will man im PVP nach oben gelangen und gar an den mehrmals pro Jahr abgehaltenen Turnieren teilnehmen und nicht total schlecht abschneiden?
Relativ früh im Spiel sollte man sich also für einen dieser Wege entscheiden. Nicht weil man irgendwann danach gefragt wird und sich alles im Spiel danach richtet, sondern damit man nicht den Spass am Spiel verliert.

Ich habe mich für den Aufbau eines guten Decks rund um den "Dunklen Magier" entschieden. Mein anfängliches Deck hatte bereits gute Karten dabei, doch ab einem gewissen lvl bei den PVP-Spielen verlor ich nur noch. Mit einer intensiven Recherche wurde mir klar, dass die Karte noch so krass sein kann, wenn sie aber nicht schnell, relativ einfach und auch öfters eingesetzt werden kann, man keine Chance hat. Es sollte also darauf hinauslaufen, dass sozusagen stets viele Wege nach Rom führen. Muss man zu lange warten, bis eine benötigte Karte gezogen wird oder zu oft die Anfangskarten nicht gelegt werden können, verliert man meistens. Man sollte auch in der Lage sein ohne oder mit einem noch schwachen Monster Angriffe abwehren zu können oder durch die Zerstörung der Karte dafür eine andere Karte aus dem Deck, Friedhof oder der Hand setzen zu dürfen. Besteht eine grosse Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass man nach einem Angriff nichts mehr auf dem Feld stehen hat, wird man auf die Dauer nicht gewinnen können.
Man muss sich dementsprechend entscheiden, ob man sich von seinen geliebten Karten "trennt" und versucht die entsprechenden Karten zu finden oder man holt das maximale aus seinem Deck heraus und akzeptiert eine höhere Niederlagen-Quote. Ich habe mich für einen Mix entschieden. Mit meinem Deck bin ich bis zu einer höheren Silberstufe einer der besseren. Danach häufen sich Spieler mit sehr komplexen und starken Kartenkonstellationen. Mir sagen diese Karten aber meistens nichts und ich finde, dass man auch einen gewissen Bezug zu seinem Deck haben sollte, so wie Yugi in der Serie.

[h3]Karten erhalten:[/h3]
Gelegenheitsspieler werden es schwer haben ohne Geld in die Hand zu nehmen gute Karten zu ergattern. Wenn man sich mit seinem erspielten "Geld" Packs kauft, ist die Wahrscheinlichkeit, wie beim Glücksspiel gering, dass man eine Top-Karte erhält. Die sogenannten UR-Cards sind pro Box meistens nur 1x erhalten. Schlechtere können 10x vertreten sein. Man kann sich also selber ausrechnen, wie viele Packs man teilweise kaufen muss, damit die gewünschte Karte enthalten ist. Wie unter dem Punkt Decks bereits angedeutet, braucht man teilweise mehrere gleiche Karten (ausser sie sind auf 1 oder 2 Karten pro Deck limitiert) damit man schneller die gewünschte Karte auf der Hand hat. Somit fängt das Spiel wieder von vorne an. Die Box wird auf Anfang gestellt und man muss wieder etliche Male Packs kaufen. Das klingt nun sehr danach, dass es ohne Geld nicht geht. JEIN. Mit sehr sehr viel Zeit und täglichem Öffnen des Games erhält man wirklich viele Boni, auch um direkt gewisse Karten (viele mittelmässige und mit der Zeit wenig gute Karten) auszuwählen und zu besitzen. Öffnet man so viele Packs wie ich einst, und sicher viele andere auch, kann es schon einmal vorkommen, dass man für sein Deck geniale Karten mit den ersten Packs erwischt und dann gleich wieder. Mischeln ist eben Glückssache und manchmal kann das Glück auch auf der richtigen Seite sein. Dann gibt es aber auch wieder Phasen, da zieht man bis zuletzt, um die gewünschte Karte zu erhalten. Um dann ohne echtes Geld am Ball zu bleiben, muss man gewisse wiederholende Spiele gegen die "KI" aushalten, um wieder an die benötigte Währung zu gelangen. In manchen Momenten war auch ich schwach und griff zu echtem Geld. Schlussendlich habe ich dieses schon wesentlich schlechter investiert. Von irgendwas muss ja der Entwickler auch leben.

Seit ich mein gewünschtes Deck habe und keine passendere Karte neu eingeführt wurde, habe ich nichts mehr erworben. Einerseits ist es schade, denn es macht in gewissem Masse das Spiel aus. Früher auf dem Pausenhof hat man auch meistens nur Packs geöffnet und Karten getauscht.

[h3]Gratis-Tipp zum Schluss:[/h3]
+ Zu viele Karten im Deck (mehr als 20 bis 22) machen nur Sinn, wenn man viele Karten auf den Friedhof schmeissen muss, um gewisse Effekte zu erzielen oder bestimmte Karten zu beschwören.
+ Drachen-Decks sind (für den Anfang) relativ einfach zusammenzustellen und sehr effektiv, da Drachen laufend auch vom Friedhof oder Deck (erneut) beschworen werden können.

[h3]Fazit:[/h3]
Wenn man einmal im Spiel ist, bereitet es viel Freude. Gerade komplexe Beschwörungen und Effekte, die weitere auslösen, haben etwas an sich. Das Spiel ist mehr als nur Nostalgie. 
Eine klare Empfehlung!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152158610', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 28730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27420, 'last_played': 1711062020}
review:
Behold, the single worst game a new player could possibly experience in their entire lives. If you've never played yugioh before, literally get out. Genuinely I'm real sorry you won't be able to experience this game that I love so much but oh my lord dude, if you really think you're about to jump in and have any shot at learning how the game works, here's some barriers you'll soon encounter on your journey:
1. Hundreds of different archetypes of cards you'll have to learn where and how to interrupt combo lines.
2. Cards loaded with enough text to match not only the bible, but every single version of the bible ever created throughout history. Every language, every typo from some dude in the 1400s who was hand writing them.
3. If you think you can learn the game in ranked, you're still getting beaten to death with one turn kills and people negating every play you try to make, even in bronze.
4. If you think you can learn the game in casual, you're fighting robots. Actual, real robots that are playing the game for people to grind gems while they do other stuff. They're beatable sure, but just so you know, that is straight up not a real person.
5. Duel Links is a pretty expensive way to play the game compared to Master Duel (don't play that either c:)
6. Duels are usually decided by turn 2. People either win on turn 2, or pass and lose on turn 3. Games will sometimes go on longer but Duel Links is being pushed farther and farther in that direction as modern decks continue being added.

Anyway, I normally talk about the achievements in games I review. So I'll do that super fast.

Actual garbage. Basically auto duel against npcs seven hundred million times to get to stage 50, and log in every day for a year or two to get prismatic cards from events, or gems which can then be spent on cards that can possibly also be prismatics. That's it. Those are the only two achievements that take any effort and OH MY GOD do they take a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198984018109', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 16806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16413, 'last_played': 1707334576}
review:
1. Jogabilidade:

Pontos Positivos: "Duel Links" mantém a essência estratégica dos duelos de Yu-Gi-Oh! enquanto ajusta algumas regras para se adequar ao formato mobile. A interface é intuitiva, e os duelos rápidos são ideais para partidas casuais.
Pontos de Melhoria: Para os jogadores acostumados com o jogo de cartas físico, algumas modificações nas regras podem parecer limitantes. No entanto, isso também contribui para duelos mais dinâmicos.
2. Gráficos e Apresentação:

Pontos Positivos: Os gráficos são nítidos e bem adaptados para telas menores. As animações dos monstros e os efeitos visuais dos cards são bem executados.
Pontos de Melhoria: Em dispositivos mais antigos, o desempenho gráfico pode ser um problema. Além disso, algumas animações prolongadas podem tornar os duelos menos ágeis.
3. Sistema de Progressão:

Pontos Positivos: "Duel Links" oferece uma progressão equilibrada, com desafios, eventos e recompensas que incentivam os jogadores a continuarem jogando. A adição de novos decks e cartas mantém o conteúdo fresco.
Pontos de Melhoria: A obtenção de cartas específicas pode parecer lenta para jogadores mais casuais, e o sistema de microtransações pode ser percebido como sendo bastante presente.
4. Comunidade e Multijogador:

Pontos Positivos: O jogo possui uma comunidade ativa, e os modos multijogador, como Duelos Ranqueados e Torneios, oferecem uma experiência competitiva interessante.
Pontos de Melhoria: Algumas queixas da comunidade estão relacionadas ao balanceamento de cartas, e eventos especiais podem favorecer jogadores que investem mais tempo ou dinheiro no jogo.
5. Suporte Contínuo:

Pontos Positivos: A Konami fornece atualizações regulares, introduzindo novas cartas, personagens e eventos. Isso mantém o interesse da comunidade e adiciona camadas à estratégia do jogo.
Pontos de Melhoria: Algumas mudanças nas regras e balanceamento podem gerar controvérsias, e uma comunicação mais transparente com os jogadores poderia ser benéfica.

review: one of the worst digital card games I've ever played. I've never seen a digital card game be THIS FUCKING SCUMMY before. You either spend several thousand dollars on a  single deck or you spend half a year or more farming for it. Every other digital card game has some kind of crafting or guarantee system but this one does not. In fact its even worse than that because each box only a has a sinlge copy of each UR so after you pull the 180 packs required to get a single copy of the ur, you need to reset the box and pull 180 more packs for the second copy, and then 180 more for the third. Play master duel instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044775491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 360, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1712409830}
review:
O Yugioh por si só, como um TCG, é um jogo péssimo para novos jogadores, muito dificíl de aprensetar, muito complexo e com um powerlevel bizarro atualmente.
O Duel Links é um jogo que possui um início muito desafiador e chato para novos jogadores para conseguirem se estabelecer no meta, já que os decks iniciais são injogáveis e o jogador precisa de tempo para farmar e tentar montar um deck barato e bom. Combinado com tudo isso, o farm é MUITO chato.
No entanto, apesar de um início de jogo muito chato, após conseguir construir uma conta com inúmeros decks rodáveis no metagame atual, você embarca de fato na proposta maravilhosa do jogo.
E qual a proposta do jogo? Fazer você mergulhar no mundo do anime de yugioh, fingir ser os personagens dos animes de Yugioh, umara parada meio RPG mesmo, saca? Isso é muito bom porque, pessoalmente, eu só acompanhei os animes até o Yugioh 5ds e após esse teve mais 4 animes de yugioh que vi pouco eu só sei de vista, mas tive a oportunidade de conhecer parcialmente a história dos mundos e dos personagens pelo Duel Links! Também joguei muito o TCG até meados de 2015, quando descobri o Duel Links conheci um pública que joga ativamente e criadores de conteúdo, o que na minha época de TCG o pessoal tinha que se virar para conseguir entender o jogo.
Então, basicamente, o saldo do jogo é positivo. Se você é um fã da cultura de yugioh e já jogou ou joga TCG, dê uma chance para o duel links que você irá adorar o jogo, apesar da governança podre da Konami rs
