review:
Se você ficasse mais tempo jogando em vez de ficar 50 horas farmando gema para gastar em pacotes que tem uma grande chance de não vir a carta que tu quer, seria o melhor jogo de yu-gi-oh sem zoeira, mas é extremamente chato farmar essa porra de gema, e por conta disso você desiste de investir nesse deck que tu quer para fica com o seu deck paia e ultrapassado, e ter uma chance minima de ir bem nas ranqueada, porque só vai bem quem tem dinheiro para comprar uma box todinha.                                 
                                                                                                                                                                              
Recomendo muito foda 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198846538510', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1531058612}
review:
I am a 45 years old father with a teenage son who loves playing video games. I have always struggled to connect with my son as he spends most of his free time playing games online or watching others play on YouTube. As a busy single father, I found it difficult to spend quality time with him.

But recently, my son introduced me to a game called Yu-Gi-Oh Duel Links, and I decided to create a Steam account so we could play together. It had been decades since I last played a video game, so I was quite rusty. But my son patiently taught me how to play and we started bonding over this game.

I was pleasantly surprised by how much fun we had playing together. It was like we were solving a mystery together, laughing and having a great time. Playing video games with my son reminded me of the joy of being a kid and it helped me to connect with my son on a whole new level. We even started spending more time together outside of the game, going on walks and enjoying other activities.

As a single father, it can be difficult to find common ground with my son, but video games have given us a new way to bond and spend quality time together. I am grateful for this opportunity to connect with my son and make lasting memories together.

author: {'steamid': '76561199302824078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6772, 'last_played': 1684462405}
review: P2W. Un juego bastante des-balanceado, que gracia tiene intentar acumular gemas y crear un Deck si al final están las cartas xyz con sus mil invocaciones y mil efectos, así ni porque se logre tener una mano inicial de lujo se puede con esto. Al menos las invocaciones por sincronía tienen sus restricciones y al menos es mas interesante batirse a duelo de modo que existen posibilidades de competir. Eran emocionante los duelos, ahora solo les falta que puedan atacar desde el primer turno con sus múltiples invocaciones y múltiples efectos, me hace gracia que durante tanta invocación no se les acabe el tiempo limite.

author: {'steamid': '76561199105871228', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4071, 'last_played': 1707848710}
review:
Tengo un fetiche muy extraño con los Dragones Blancos de Ojos Azules por culpa de este juego, no puedo dejar de usar mazos que contengan al Dragón Blanco de Ojos Azules.
Mi carta favorita es el Dragón Blanco de Ojos Azules, muy útil y poderosa, se pueden hacer buenas combinaciones con dicha carta.
Me encanta el Dragón Blanco de Ojos Azules, mi carta favorita de lejos.
Chicos, chicos prueben jugar con un mazo de Dragón Blanco de Ojos Azules, no se si lo dije pero es mi carta favorita por muy lejos.
No puedo dejar de invocar 3 Dragones Blancos de Ojos Azules por turno, es una carta que sin duda está muy rota y muy útil a la hora de jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437985038', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 335, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1711836076}
review: Listen, if you grew up with Yu-GI-Oh duel monsters on TV then you will totally love this game. I've been playing the TCG for several years and this game is a duelist dream. This game allows you to build your favorite decks from characters you love or just build a deck you always wanted to run. Personally I love the graphics, cards details, reliving the lore from the anime/manga and card events. Can't lie that it does get difficult with people running meta cards in rank but if you just want to play casual you can and duel with friends too. I've spent many hours (mobile) on the game and rarely spent money for gems since the game gives you many way to get them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315142196', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 201933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 38, 'playtime_at_review': 180358, 'last_played': 1711760661}
review:
Considerando as poucas horas de gameplay que tive, não sei se muitos irão concordar com o que digo, porém é justificável. Começando pelo meio de se obter decks, eu reclamaria pela quantidade de tempo gasto farmando que é necessária pra ter algo decente pra se jogar, não, não tem deck no jogo de fácil acesso que seja considerado decente pra jogar, vc pode comprar um estrutural de red eyes e pegar seu lendário mas a dificuldade pra subir disso vai ser a de um parto, muitos podem me dizer "ah mas e normal farmar muito pra ficar forte num jogo, acontece, tem que investir horas", ok, entendo essa afirmação, porém tenho dois pontos sobre isso:
- Primeiramente o farm é muito monótono a ponto de você zerar um evento repetitivo e nada inovador super rápido e ficar repetindo duelos completamente entediantes e cansativos no portão do jogo, o farm n é divertido como rpgs que vc sei la tenta fazer uma side-quest ou algo assim, o farm é completamente envolto de repetição cansativa e obrigatoria pra conseguir ganhar recurso;
- Segundamente, não necessariamente você farmando muito e conseguindo seu deck vai se dar bem em duelos de alto nível, pois cartas como "Compulsory Evacuation Devide", "Crackdown" e "ice dragon prison" são cartas que ganham jogos somente com sua ativação (ice dragon prison tem esse fator de forma mais bruta) e as mesmas se encontram presas em caixas limitadas onde a opção de compra por gema é retirada a partir de certo número de pacotes comprados, ou você tem sorte ou se você é pobre você vai se fuder tomando uma dessa e não tendo uma pra dar de volta.(Inclusive , o meta atual tem decks de força parecido, porém Phantom Knights tem essa vantagem sobres outros por poder usar essas famosas cartas da elite burguesa).
A empresa que gere o jogo é tão problemática ao ponto de inserir "macro" não somente na mão inicial (onde eu por exemplo num deck de 30 cartas, comprei a única cópia do dreadmaster que tenho no deck por fodendo cinco duelos seguidos) mas também em caixas de cartas, muitos e muitos absurdos relatos são postados de cartas UR de boxes que são importantissimas ficarem pro pacote número 1, eu jogo isso a cinco anos, já montei diversos decks usando dinheiro e principalmente gemas, e nenhum dos que tenho tive sorte de arranjar as cartas que eu queria no começo, salvo minimas exceções que consegui algo bom rápido que mesmo assim n impediram minha run pelo deck de ser longa e massante, meu deck de harpia fui até o fim da mini box 3 vezes, meu deck de pk fui até o fim da minobox 3 vezes, meu deck de hero me lembro até hoje, numa main box com 180 pacotes, minha primeira cópia do Anki foi no pacote 17 e minha segunda no pacote 24,  meu red eyes meteor dragon venho por volta do pacote 20 e era a única que eu tinha um deck quase montado e interesse, tomei macro até mesmo em cartas R que estavam sendo muito usadas como por exemplo o megazord do super quantum, minha primeira cópia dessa carta R só veio aparecer depois de comprar 110 pacotes numa main box, minha terceira cópia do esmaecimento do vazio foi a R que mais demorou pra pegar e mesmo sendo R e tendo 6 copias na box eu só consegui depois de abrir a box duas vezes e na segunda vez peguei ela com 120 pacotes comprados.

Sim, eu tenho muitos relatos que ficaram marcados em mim pois eu tenho muito amor por esse jogo, porém o rumo que ele tomou com skills que jogam pelos players, selection box com cartas insanas e lockadas para os jogadores com menos dinheiro, com macro em mãos iniciais e boxes e muitas outras coisas, reconheço que ninguém deve jogar isso e que só será reformulado no momento que as pessoas pararem de jogar, porém sabemos que jogar de Yu-Gi-Oh! é sequelado pelo jogo e infelizmente Duel Links é uma das poucas opções disponíveis para os fâs do jogo e do anime.

Reconheço que o jogo consegue ser muito divertido, consegue render umas boas horas de entretenimento mas isso se deve pelo fato de Yu-Gi-Oh! ser um jogo de cartas muito dahora e contagiante, claro muitas épocas existiram e o jogo foi aumentando a complexidade mas é divertido no geral e até faz a gente ignorar esses pormenores, porém esses ditos pormenores começaram a me afetar após muito tempo exposto a eles, entrem no jogo, joguem o jogo, mas saibam que em momentos vocês podem se frustrar por não ter dinheiro e serem coagidos pelo próprio jogo gastar nos mesmos por querer um estrutural ou algo em selection, muitas vezes vocês vão perder um duelo porque o oponente apertou um botão amarelo e deixou a skill fazer tudo sozinho, muitas vezes vcs vão querer uma carta e ela vai demorar muito pra vir, muitas vezes vocês vão receber blefes de brilhos UR abrindo pacotes pra na verdade ser uma carta N ou R, muitas vezes vão estar com sequencias de vitórias e perder elas pelo servidor do jogo ser horrível, muitas vezes vão sacar a cópia unica do seu deck na mão inicial de forma constante, muitas vezes vão jogar o mesmo evento de novo com mudanças mínimas , muitas vezes vão se ver horas farmando da mesma forma pra abrir 40 packs e as vezes nem isso, muitas vezes o jogo vai te dar gemas de recompensa e você vai gastar elas e n pegar nada e acabar percebendo que 1000 gemas são 20 pacotes duma main box com 180 pacotes que você abre 3 vezes.

Resumo pra quem não quer ler:
- Yu-Gi-Oh! é legal
- Duel links é ruim graças a Konami

Devo jogar Duel Links?
Você deve jogar duel links sim, exceto se você for uma pessoa que preza por qualidade e por ser respeitado como consumidor.

author: {'steamid': '76561199446451949', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1688646110}
review:
A surprisingly fair monetization model for a F2P game published by Konami, no premium currency, and all in-game currencies are earned solely through gameplay, you can however spend real money to buy structure decks or packs but all in-game currencies can be earned in abundance through leveling up characters, pvp, missions, and events. There's usually a main event every week along with a side event or two, prizes for which often include plenty of cards, gems, cosmetic card sleeves, and game mats as well as a new character every so often. There is plenty of deck build possibilities providing varied and deep gameplay, typically exemplified by card archetypes, of which there are plenty.

I do however wish there were more permanent and involved single-player content, more duel formats that remain available outside of events, and the starter decks for almost every character are practically unusable, which can severely hinder the early game experience and is only slightly offset by the admittedly sizable amount of free giveaways that new and returning players are often hit with.

author: {'steamid': '76561199095501152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8951, 'last_played': 1652776328}
review:
Duel Links es un juegazo en el tema artistico. 10/10. Incluso mejor que algunos juegos de Yu-Gi-Oh

Recomendaba mucho este juego. Pero ya no más. Konami ha estado destruyendo este juego poco a poco. Literalmente ahora ya no puedes hacer un deck competitivo.

¿Por que?
Simple. Demoras en farmear gemas como loco, te mamas HORAS Y HORAS en completar la mayoria de eventos QUE SON ABURRIDOS A MAS NO PODER. Consigues después de semanas todas las cartas que estan repartidas en MUCHAS cajas. y cuando por fin tienes tu deck competitivo, te cae banlist o aparece un deck mejor al siguiente mes. Que deja inutil a tu deck competitivo.
Puedes hacer nuevamente la tarea de los eventos y tener MUCHISIMA MAS PACIENCIA DE LA QUE YA TENIAS. Pero no, cada vez se hace mas imposible. 
Konami ahora deja una miseria de gemas. Con ese deck competitivo que farmeaste a lo mucho podrás llegar a Platino, o si tienes mucha suerte, a Leyenda. Y lo peor es que cada vez este modelo de farmeo se vuelve tedioso, y en un todo, terminarás odiando el juego. 

Y ahi es cuando entra el P2W. Seamos honestos. este juego es P2W. No P2F. Actualmente es imposible tener los deck meta a tiempo, y cuando los tienes, o te cae baneo, o ya ha aparecido un deck mas competente que el demoraste semanas en obtener. Esto me ha pasado muchas veces. Juego esto con mi movil desde el 2018 hasta el 2022 porque se hizo horrible. 

En conclusion. Si quieres jugar Duel Links, solo juega casual. Si quieres jugar competitivo, mejor compra las cartas fisicas. Creeme que será una mejor inversión.

author: {'steamid': '76561199037348336', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 170724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 107, 'playtime_at_review': 166283, 'last_played': 1712491836}
review:
Deck building and meta are regulated around profit, little around balanced gameplay. Grindy F2P, highly P2W. 
After playing for 2 years, I have learnt that Trading Card Game is an unhealthy genre. Play something that doesn't constantly powercreep and obsolete playables in-game on a tri-monthly basis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198822832105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1593971432}
review:
Had probably 400+ hours on mobile, maybe more, between enjoying world chat (before spam bot garbage) and casual/ranked play.

It was good back when it released and for the first three years. Started to simply be watered down modern YGO after adding link summons.

It's a shame because, while all this isn't a bad thing for more modern competitive/contemporary players, this game captured (or rather "had") the charm of that old school style YGO (later adding GX, 5D's, etc). 

After they added Syncro, it was clear to me what would eventually follow. So I just enjoyed the game for what it was while I could. And that truly was nice while it lasted. I appreciate how the earlier versions of DL brought in both new players and old school players like myself to this clear labor of love.

Nowadays, unless the speed duel format is your preferred cup of coffee, you might as well just go play Master Duel now. GGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198954776759', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9168, 'last_played': 1702928250}
review:
Eu amo o Duel Links, jogo ele desde 2018, já platinei ele mas nunca me interessei em chegar longe pra pegar KOGS.
O único ponto negativo que eu acho é os Bans e Limitações de cartas que a Konami impõe no jogo, acho que se ela liberasse todas as cartas e todas limitações, o jogo seria mais inclusivo na montagem de decks, seria extremamente difícil existir decks Tier 0, já que as opções de montagem de deck seria infinita!

review:
Great game,But very hard to get into.  4 / 5

the Gatcha system that this game build on is allways going to make this a pay to win game. but this do not make it imposible to make a few good deck if you are a free to play player.
Duel links have been more and more giving in there Gems. There is allways an avent going on, were you can get more gems. Just know that if you want this free stuff. You will have to FARM it. and that will take time.

as a long time player this game needs to add 2 vs 2 play mode. many are missing this and for me it will make the game alot better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308103017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1678987800}
review: If you are wanting to go into PVP, you better prepare a Tier 0 deck and your ass (the latter in case it gets beaten by a player who can be an asshole and wreck your strategy come Turn 2). Because of the way PVP events and PVP duels are set up in Duel Links, you will lose almost 100% of the time, it's too unfair for casual players like me who just want to have fun (But then again, how can you have fun when your main objective is to win against everyone you come across? But instead of winning against everyone, I'm blocking everyone. Just to make sure they don't face off with me again). I'm so sick of this bullshit, I'm taking a hiatus the moment a new PVP event starts up. KC Cup, World Riding Duel Grand Prix, Action Duel PVP event, etc. All these events can go kiss my ass. The only thing I want from this game going forward is LESS PVP, MORE PVE!!! SCREW PVP, shove it up your ass!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054004608', 'num_games_owned': 3276, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 24498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24498, 'last_played': 1677259588}
review: Let me start out by saying I'm a huge Yu-Gi-Oh! fan, but I'm a bigger Kaiba fan myself. In short, I went with the full on Blue Eyes White Dragon deck, pimped that bad boy out with some Alternate Blue Eyes White Dragon, Sage with the Blue Eyes and some other cards of the names I can't recall. My deck was killer!! I floored some punks around town like it was nothing. And then they started link summoning and I lost on turn 1 when I couldn't even summon anything. That's when I realised, I'm trash at this game and will probably never be good again. So I pushed for all the achievements and called it a day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198912051140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5380, 'last_played': 1706627918}
review: The classic Yu-gi-oh card game in a quick-play, 3 card format. The desire to get certain cards for my deck kept me playing and coming back. It is difficult to get the cards you need if you don't plan on buying with real money. Despite that, the desire to win and the desire to improve your deck will most likely keep you hooked, especially if you have some nostalgia for the anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116081180', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 68005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 497, 'playtime_at_review': 44813, 'last_played': 1712254776}
review: Desde o lançamento de Yu-Gi-Oh, diversos foram os jogos que tentaram emular o jogo de cartas em ambientes virtuais. Afirmo sem a menor dúvida, Duel Links foi o primeiro grande sucesso. Apesar de possuir regras distintas do jogo tradicional, as adaptações feitas casaram muito bem com o jogo. A disponibilidade de cartas que o jogo possui é imensa, praticamente todas existentes. Além disso, trazem diversos personagens históricos da franquia, independente de qual geração seja, sem falar nos diferentes ambientes de jogo e personalização que oferece. Resumindo: boa interface e boa imersão no universo Yu-Gi-Oh. O jogo possui uma grande quantidade de eventos (alguns repetitivos), mas oferece diversas formas de jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111824932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1679030295}
review: Could not possibly scream PTW any louder. The auto-setting to refresh boxes after you collected all UR's is malicious af bc the cards I wanted are SR's and pull chances are already garbage when you can pull 20+ copies of the worthless filth commons. The crafting system screams PTW where it's basically impossible to craft a deck unless you spend 20+ years playing. Master Duel is superior in every way except AI RNG, they're both busted with cheating to provide 'challenge.' Just simply not worth grinding my life away to get anywhere in this game, and with expirations on freebies just solidify my motivation to never come back to this atrocious game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310950113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1647661178}
review: Tiene una gran cantidad de cartas y opciones de juego, lo que puede resultar confuso y frustrante para los jugadores nuevos. Si bien el juego tiene una guía de tutorial, puede que necesites dedicar tiempo para comprender todas las mecánicas y estrategias de juego. Si esto te parece abrumador, te recomiendo comenzar con un mazo preconstruido y jugar algunas partidas para familiarizarte con el juego antes de empezar a construir tu propio mazo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378589171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 25919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 29, 'playtime_at_review': 18094, 'last_played': 1711944860}
review:
+ Speed Duel format is more simple and easier to follow.
+ The card pool is (used to be) tailored to prevent certain crazy things that used to occur in the TCG.
+ Certain decks that never flourished IRL got their big time in this game.
+ The character and anime integrations are a very nice touch. Very expressive and entertaining.

- Time-gated unlocks behind events.
- Very grindy, time consuming, and much less f2p. If you want a super meta deck NOW before people start expecting it to be hit on the banlist expect to pay $$$.
- Box model is very meh. Older archetypes and generic staple cards can be in older boxes containing mostly non-relevant cards, but this is usually what dream tickets are for.
- Lately the devs have been very liberal with their skill/balance design and card releases (game-defining staple cards exclusive to newer limited-time BOXes, full power mekk knights, almost all of gouki, xyz galaxy skill) which has led to pretty toxic formats. Powercreep moment, the worst part is that IT CAN GET WORSE.

As a f2p player who has gotten dlv20 many times, I'd say the game is fine to play as long as you don't spend egregious amounts of money. It's still possible to build good decks as long as you save gems and be responsible about what BOXes you open and when.

review: I have been playing Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links on my mobile for a while, but since it became available on Steam, I have been able to play on my computer, and I have to say, I am very impressed with this game. Duel Links is an amazing game that every fan of the anime series should try. It is easy to learn, yet challenging to master, and it has a great variety of cards that you can use to build your deck. You can even battle with other players in online matches, which adds to the excitement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343443008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5064, 'last_played': 1699667254}
review: Na minha opinião, e já passei por diversos Cards Games (físicos e virtuais), o Yu-Gi-Oh (TCG/OCG) é o melhor e mais interessante jogo de cartas. Entretanto, o formato tradicional com partidas alongadas não era compatível com a dinamicidade do formato Mobile. E o Duel Links veio justamente com essa proposta, isto é, ser um jogo direto, rápido e dinâmico; e, dentro do possível, bem adaptado a estrutura Mobile. Então, você pode jogar no PC ou - em qualquer lugar - por meio do seu Smartphone. Recomendo.

今日は何の祝日でもありません。いいねをしてもあなたの鶏の巴を長くしたり短くしたりすることはありません。あなたの身長を3センチも張らせたり、一夜にして大金持ちになって人生の頂点に立つこともありません
でもsteamポイントをください私はsexテーマを買いたいです。私はここにいる皆さんに何も与えることはできませんが、私は冥冥冥の中であなたたちを祝福します

author: {'steamid': '76561198017158064', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 30587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 257, 'playtime_at_review': 28513, 'last_played': 1711826154}
review: It is Yu-Gi-Oh but Speed Duel format. It was seen as better before Master Duel came around, which has a better monetization scheme but Duel Links has a lot better single player content and not just "do a section of campaigns for decks that were only meta a decade ago at best" and then do the Ranked Latter. If you want to play Speed Duel Format instead of Master Duel format though, this game is for you! If you don't... Play Master Duel or a fan simulator! Master Duel used to not be an option but it is now! And the card pool is very similar due to the updates Duel Links has been getting!

review:
The planned obsolescence on this game is absurd. Videogames should not relay on the last batch of items to win.

Because of that, I would not recommend it as a kid-friendly game. Duel Links used to be great, but lately all decks become obsolete every 3 months because of the new cards they release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338825890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4637, 'last_played': 1632559555}
review: Game used to be very fun for having all of the best parts of Yugioh but with the curated card list that omitted most (unfortunately not all) of the egregious design mistakes made in paper. As years went on and power creep took its course, it lost that charm, and now it's just become baby IRL yugioh, in which case just play it in paper. I genuinely uninstalled the moment they added Link Summoning, because that was by far the worst mechanic added to the actual game, somehow trumping Pendulums. I've played Yugioh competitively for many, many years and I understand it very well. I think what Duel Links attempted to do was worthy of merit, but alas all good things must end. I'm sure it has appeal somewhere in its current design, it just doesn't do what I wanted out of it anymore. Also, after playing Master Duel the lack of ability to dismantle garbage towards making cards you actually want feels fucking atrocious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376220706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1691585510}
review:
What keeps me playing: 
- Fully voiced, dynamic avatars from across all the series. 
- Surprising amount of voice lines covering multitude of cards, summons, activation, etc. 
- Avatar Skills! It is honestly a refreshing thing to see, and I love being able to pull out a 7 Completed from Bandit Keith's sleeve. 
- Plentiful PvE casual duels, challenging PvE events and bosses and I never feel pressured to play PvP. 

I always find myself coming back to this one over Link Evolution or Master Duel. The gem grind can be a little bit of a pain but doesn't feel as bad as other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047278476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1710610023}
review:
Duel Links is Yu-Gi-Oh Lite. A more restricted, faster paced game with a focus on the anime and its characters. You build your deck, select your favorite character from whichever series, and then duel to earn access to more cards and abilities. Each character has a set of abilities that can be used in duels if certain conditions are met, adding a layer of strategy.

 I primarily play on mobile, and as far as mobile games go, I find it to be more consumer friendly than most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056711152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 509, 'playtime_at_review': 24649, 'last_played': 1712073615}
review:
As of review post. 410 hours played on Yu-Gi-Oh Duel Links (Perfected Achievements):

Likes
- The art style, it's very anime with some cool looking animations for very recognisable monsters
- Different rules to regular Yu-gi-oh, not as complicated generally. (Expanded overtime)
- Quick and easy to also play on the go (Mobile friendly)
- It can be very fun to watch online, i.e. Replays from tournaments/deck profiles/farm decks etc.
- Filter and sort options are excellent compared to other style games, there's search/popular cards/decklists.
- Trying to add your own challenges can make the game more fun, i.e. you can copy opponents decks/lists
- Skills for the characters gives more variety, it's unique in that respect generally.
- There's a ton of ways to play now, you can focus on say a particular deck you like or just play casual.

Dislike
- Sometimes when you login there's a ton of pop up type actions to perform can get annoying after a while.
- There's not really any incentives for extra gold once you have most things unlocked (This may Change?)
- Some of the older events were really good but have never really came back unfortunately.
- There's a lot of newer cards from recent years still missing meaning some decks are quite underpowered.
- "Some skills and characters are quite difficult to unlock" unless you really go out of your way to get them.
- Many of the previous better skills got massive restrictions so now nearly useless to the average player.

Why I would recommend:
- It's Free (Plenty of stuff is given out quite regularly)
- Pretty simple to understand and play if you have ever played any standard Yu-gi-oh at all
- It's a very mobile friendly game so can play on the go when out and about
- Has quite regular updates ie. new events/card boxes/bug fixes/limit list/characters etc.
- Fun to play with a friend/small group, especially if you set up your "own rules".
- There's not really a limit/end game, because there's new regular content and the "meta" changes often.

*Note this is coming as a free to play player who has been playing since the game was released.

EDIT (on 24/01/24) : 
Rush Duels being added since my first review has given the game a new way to play it.
- There's a new ranked ladder option with new characters to level up, rush duel boxes/structures
- Gems you do earn from it can also be used in the main speed duel parts of duel links which makes it an extra source of easy gems even if you don't want to play it much. 

All in all it's a nice addition to an already amazing versatile game for yugioh fans alike, I wouldn't be surprised if we see more and more new rush duel characters/cards over the next few years further increasing the games already great potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205223253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4039, 'last_played': 1676067271}
review: Está bueno para introducir al Juego ya que tiene personajes del Anime y personajes reconocibles famosos como son Yugi y Kaiba. También introduce a los otros anime y eso que yo me perdí de GX para adelante ya no conocía a nadie. Sobre el gameplay, el juego te explica bien como son los nuevos métodos de invocación y por si alguien no juega desde tipo el 2005 o 2010, este juego está bueno para aprender de nuevo y para veteranos de la saga es bueno, me sorprende que este juego lleve sus años manteniéndose bien, si te interesa YuGiOh pero no sabes donde empezar, este juego puede estar bien.

review:
Sure, its fun and awesome, but rank will piss you off after Silver. everyone will have 1 turn kill decks where you will watch them for half an hour doing their first turn, and when it is your turn, everything is negated and your summons banished, you lose first turn, if you get the 1st turn you will be negated and they will special summon with the XYZ decks for 1 hour, negate all your cards and banish them and even if you have a great effect card, its useless, because the new cards ruins the game and are overpowered and everyone uses the same damn deck.
5 outta 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323680086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3863, 'last_played': 1640952958}
review:
Me jugue este juego hasta no poder sacarle más provecho, pero en móviles.
Llega un punto donde ya no tenes más gemitas para sacar cartas, tenes que esperar eventos y, para ese momento, ya te cambiaron el meta 500 veces. De todas formas, eso solo se nota cuando ya llevas tiempo y no podes subir más de nivel a ningun personaje xd. Si recién comienzas tenes tantas gemas que no sabes que hacer con ellas.
El sistema de habilidades está bueno, gracias a eso pude usar el mazo de Za Warudo sin miedo al rng mientras spameaba las lineas de dialogo del Sartorius.
No obstante, existiendo Master Duel (con más catálogo, más formas de obtener cartas, las reglas originales, todos los espacios, un meta más estable, etc.), no recomiendo bajar esto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990484116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1675905045}
review:
Came here from the mobile version, it's 100x better than Master Duel. You don't NEED to pay real money but it'll help which brings me to the main criticism of the game/players.

If you use a pre-made deck you are trash. 

Trust me, you'll run into this a lot with people instantly getting a board full of 3000atk + summons on their first turn, just leave the timer to run down the 5 minutes for your turn and go make yourself a drink or some food, waste their time because they're obviously no lifers who shouldn't get to enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199073604270', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1678187286}
review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198407549798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7650, 'last_played': 1688870999}
review:
I don't play a lot of deck-builder games, Duel Links has been the best. And though the updates and events may be slow sometimes, you can actually do well as a Free to Play player, unlike a lot of the others. I highly recommend duel links.

My only feedback really is that Pendulum Zones should not be locked to certain characters, and it should be universally available. The way they have it now, unless you have certain skills, your Pendulum zones take up your Spell/Trap card zones, which is not good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267759860', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 48062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48062, 'last_played': 1664395332}
review: I have been playing Yu-Gi-Oh! since the late 2000s and i have pretty much seen the entire scene develop. When it comes to this game i have also been playing it since day 1 with a couple of breaks here and there. But i can safely say that i think its finally time for me to put this game to rest, it was a fun experience but i would not recommend this game in 2023 to anyone. If you still want to play a Yu-Gi-Oh! game master duel is better because of the variety of decks. its cheaper to build any deck(s) you want but there is still a fuck tonne of grind. I would not recommend any of these games but if you absolutely want to play something Master Duel is an objectively better Yu-Gi-Oh! experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065569001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 36465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26684, 'last_played': 1696399628}
review:
〇悪い点
・Pay to Win (金を出せば勝てる)の典型  銭ゲバリンクス

・マスターデュエルには"分解"と"生成"があるが
ㅤリンクスには無く 必要なカードを揃えるのが苦行

・BOXガチャにゴミを混ぜすぎ
「〇〇を再録!!」という かさ増し 
ㅤNやRをBOXに4枚以上 入れる必要は無いですよねぇ…
ㅤ同名カードはデッキに3枚までしか入れられないですもんねぇ…

〇良い点
・キャラクターにボイスが付いていたり、
ㅤスキルが存在する 良いキャラゲー

・マスターデュエルと比較すると試合時間が短く
ㅤサクッと試合をできる (偶に害悪長期戦デッキも居ますが…)

・アップデートが頻繁に行われたり、LIMIT(禁止制限)もよく変更される
ㅤ週替わりでイベントがあるので飽きにくい

author: {'steamid': '76561198389956489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20328, 'last_played': 1693610795}
review: Aqui deixo minha grande insatisfação com o sistema de batalhas online do jogo, especialmente o ranqueado devido a problemas com o servidor da Konami e a prática de disconnect dos players em que o player perdedor abusa disso e na maioria das vezes o que estava vencendo acaba por empatar a partida dependendo da estabilidade da sua rede sendo que o adversário que disconectou. O jogo essencialmente é muito divertido, pelo menos para mim, só que isso estraga demais o processo pelas ranqueadas e acaba gerando frustrações desnecessárias. Espero que isso mude, porque para mim a experiência é muito horrível (tenho que jogar com VPN por causa de um problema com o roteador e os servidores da Konami). É isso, o jogo é bem legal e divertido só que esses problemas acabam irritando e deixando o online bem mais chato (o competitivo no caso).

author: {'steamid': '76561199122297504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 31824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2231, 'playtime_at_review': 10555, 'last_played': 1712493437}
review: PvE is great, being able to use jank against ai is endlessly fun. Events are plentiful and mostly fun, always something going on. PvP is fun and fast paced, but this is where you'll find the gap between new players and old players is the biggest, strictly card-pool speaking. Pulling cards is a pain, honestly. The feeling of pulling a card you want loses its luster after you've opened 178/180 packs of the box for it. Aside from the annoying way we can obtain cards, this game is great and supremely addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432416043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2365, 'last_played': 1689688637}
review:
Drecks game! Ab Rang Legendary kann man absteigen, wenn man 3 Spiele in Folge verliert. Trotzdem steigt man erst bei 5 Siegen auf. Ich hatte eine fucking 8er Winstreak und hab mein Rank up match wegen einer absolut räudigen Starthand verloren und dann die nächsten 2 auch mit wirklich schlechter Starthand. So ein schlechtes System. 

Übrigens ist PVP allgemein der reinste Grind. Es gibt die Ränge: Anfänger 1-3, Bronze 1-7, Silber 1-7, Gold 1-7, Platin 1-7, Legendär 1-5 und KoG. Insgesamt also 37 und um aufzusteigen muss man einfach nur eine bestimmte Anzahl von Spielen gewinnen und jeder Lose wirt einen wieder einen Schritt zurück. Und wenn man von Legendary 5 zu KoG aufsteigen will, braucht man 5 Siege in Folge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207297341', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2216, 'last_played': 1586233141}
review: Overall, Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links is a fun and engaging mobile game for fans of the franchise. The graphics are great, the gameplay is smooth and easy to pick up, and the card pool is vast. However, the game does have its downsides, particularly its pay-to-win system and matchmaking, which can make it difficult to progress without spending real money. Additionally, there are also a number of bugs and glitches that can be frustrating. While fans of the series may enjoy the game despite its issues, others may want to look for alternative card games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156664436', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1659297571}
review:
Also nachdem ich einen freund bodenlos ins schattenreich geschickt habe nach einigen Handy runden des Glorreichen Spiels wusste ich nicht wie mir geschieht.

An den tag danach nachdem als er sich 500 € Booster Packs ins Gemüt geballert hat konnte ich nichts mehr machen und bin ins bodenlose loch des Schattenreichs gestürzt wo ich zurzeit Immernoch verweile.

Muss schon sagen das Game ballert anders nicht mal Yugi himself ist so Deep im schattenreich geballert wurden wie der besagte Kollege am ersten Spiel tag. Dazu muss ich sagen bin ein Casual Spieler und der besagte Kollege denkt er ist Pegasus selbst und buttert dementsprechend scheine ins Gemüt des tollen Spielentwicklers 

 TOP GAME 

Grüsli Müsli ihr Bananenbieger

author: {'steamid': '76561198114782528', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 15189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1685386093}
review:
Als Fan von Forbidden Memories bin ich gleich mal verliebt in das Game gewesen. Alle Edition darin enthalten und alle weiteren Serien + Charaktere ebenfalls.

Auch wenn mich Forbidden Memories für die PS1 und die Charaktere der ersten Staffel immer binden werden, so hat es Duel Links geschafft, mich wenigstens mal in die neueren Versionen reinzuschauen.

Leider sind mir diese XYZ-Beschwörungen usw. allesamt völlig neu, weshalb ich ein gefundenes Fressen online bin, aber das Spiel macht dennoch massiv Laune und ist für Zwischendurch immer einen Ausflug wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561199016208123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 246, 'playtime_at_review': 76675, 'last_played': 1712243102}
review: Duel Links é o melhor título da franquia que joguei na vida. Sou duelista do card game físico desde criança, joguei praticamente todos os títulos nos Playstation one, two e psp, mas o Duel Links enquanto jogo multi plataforma e competitivo, é simplesmente absurdo! Fora a dinâmica do meta. Pontos que eu particularmente não gosto, é que a Konami é bem complicada, todo dia um arquétipo novo no jogo e mais pacotes que vc vai ter que comprar pra conseguir ter o deck do meta... e isso acontece muito rápido. Meio complicado $$$. Fora isso, o jogo é sensacional. Falta versão pra macOS também.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106815103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 499, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1673194676}
review:
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links est un jeu de cartes à collectionner numérique free-to-play développé par Konami pour les plateformes iOS, Android et Microsoft Windows, basé sur le jeu de cartes à collectionner Yu-Gi-Oh! 

Le jeu est sorti le 17 novembre 2016 et il est aussi disponible sur Steam.

Donc ses points forts : 
- Le design 
- les effets
- Facile à utiliser
- les musiques
- le gameplay
- les graphismes
- les cartes
- l'univers Yu-Gi-Oh

review: I am extremely disappointed with this Yu Gi Oh game. The fact that there are characters of different races included is completely unacceptable. How dare they try to include diversity in a children's card game? It's clear that the creators are just trying to be politically correct and it ruins the entire experience for me. I will never purchase another Yu Gi Oh product again. Keep your diversity out of my childhood memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067891387', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 60665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40597, 'last_played': 1709067793}
review:
Pretty much same as anyone else says on here, this game has maybe 2 or 3 decks that are just better than any other deck that can be made. 

The game basically gets boring AF because in order to succeed without paying there is maybe 1 deck you will be able to (partially) make and then you can only play that boring drag over and over again, still losing to every person you come across that has dropped loads of money into the game to get full play-sets of UR and SR cards that to get one copy of with only gems would take buying anywhere from 20 to 60 packs. (good ol' scum of the earth dropping their not-so-hard earned cash on games, ruining the game for those of us who work hard for the salary we earn with those quarter a year hourly wage raise which totally keeps us from drowning in debt...)

It is also constantly disappointing because there are tons of different interesting engines that just aren't worthy of using, partially again because slimy, wealthy, albeit probably depressed and lonely, turd eaters, who spend money on this game, but also partially because Konami is either to unintelligent to create parody, or too soulless. (my bet honestly is on both)

Don't get me wrong, I obviously play this game plenty, I make Platinum every refresh of the PVP (which probably isn't that impressive, but once you get to platinum it becomes relatively pointless to even apply oneself to further heights), but honestly if you have any way of playing Yu-Gi-Oh with friends or on a home-brew game or even a classic game (gameboy advance, ps2, etc.) Those are gonna be your best bet for entertainment that doesn't make you want to just swear off this game alltogether.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132273302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1636, 'last_played': 1672002191}
review:
I like the speed duel format in concept, but what an ugly, annoying game that Konami has wrapped it up in. 

Every time you enter the game, you're forced to endure multiple long forced promotion screens popping up. Then, if there's an event, you're forced to suffer through one of their shottily animated, slow cutscenes. When you do get into the game, you have to navigate between menus through their ugly, clunky street-view interface. And beyond that, you need to toggle between yugioh generations to reach certain screens. It is very poorly done. 

There are far too many currencies / collectables, to the point that it's overwhelming for new players as well as returning players. The key/portal system is grindy and not fun. Grinding against CPU players on the streets is slow and boring. It's too bad that they feature singleplayer vs AI so prominently in this game only to make it so unenjoyable. 

On the bright side, they went on to do a much better job with the interfaces in Master Duel. Less is more. Hopefully, they bring the Rush duel format over to america eventually and do a better job with the game.

review: This is a great way for people who are either new to the game entirely or who haven't kept up with the format of the game to learn how it works, I didn't get involved since pendulum and link were added to the series and this game has allowed me to learn how to use those dueling styles and therefore can use them within other games and in person. They only thing I would want to alter is make some of the rarer cards to be a little easier to obtain but even still there is an amazing card selection and even if you don't get the specific card you want you get plenty of cards to choose from to take it's place and can even stride to fill in the cards you don't have after auto building a deck and seeing what you are missing, using that can give you an idea of what some good decks can be and even test them out to see how they work and how they would fair against other duelist who are real people.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013111930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17097, 'last_played': 1686814722}
review: Игра полное говно, а самое главное ее портит;баланс, донат, скучные события, плохая оптимизация. Если ты хочешь нормально играть то придется данатить, так как нормальную колоду собрать без доната не реально, если  не задротить каждый день. Баланс отсуствует, добавляются новые карты которые напрочь ломают игру.  Скучные события которые не придают интереса, а самое главное не желание разработчиков улучшения проекта, на который они забили большой болт.   Еще надо учесть что игра не популярная в СНГ, да и игроков в самой игре не очень много.Есть еще жирный минус, это в том что нормальные сборки надо искать только на сторонних сайтах или у англоязычных ютуберов. А самое главное это не удобный интерфейс, который ломает все погружение и  желание играть в неё. Про баги я лучше промолчу, ведь это ещё та жопа не говоря о том, что предыдущие баги которые якобы уже давно"решимы",но почему то каким-то невиданным образом появляются снова.Я не рекомендую играть в эту игру или даже начинать играть, как и в принципе во все карточные игры!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078869282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2348, 'last_played': 1608842769}
review: Para você fã de Yu-gi-oh! que acompanhou os animes na TV aberta, esse é um ótimo jogo, regras simples, fácil de entender e garanto q vai te divertir por um bom tempo, agora para você q é fã do TCG talvez não seja uma ótima opção, ele difere muito do TCG em questão de regras e timing das rodadas, etc, e contando com o fato de que por ser um jogo grátis ele é praticamente P2W, pois os busters são vendidos com as gemas, os primeiros busters podem ser comprados sem 1 centavo, mas se vc quiser montar o deck com uma carta especifica q você não conseguiu da primeira, boa sorte você irá gastar muito dinheiro e dependera de sorte, isso acabou me afastando do jogo. Mas ainda assim foram 39h divertidas por eu ser um fã de yugioh eu me diverti muito!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087957579', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1712288123}
review:
My initial impressions of this game were not positive. The starter decks are god awful and I got trounced even in the lowest ranks of bronze PvP. Coming into this game, I new nothing of how to play Yugioh (although I have experience in other card games, like Hearthstone) and I was pretty intimidated by the long chains people were pulling off with their cards. I was about ready to give up when I happened to pull an Ancient Gear solider from a card pack. Ancient Gear Soldier happens to be a god awful card, but I remember it being one of my favorites as a kid since I loved the aesthetic (I collected the cards but never played the game). This inspired me to see if there were any Ancient Gear oriented decks, and sure enough their is! I admittedly had to drop a little bit of Christmas money into packs (thankfully not much), but I got enough cards to construct a meta Ancient Gear deck. After that, I fell in love with the game. As someone who had no experience with this game, it took some reading and experimenting the last day to figure things out. However, now that I have I am really enjoying this game. I will also say that it helped my enjoyment that Ancient Gear happened to also be the exact archetype I would want to play in a card game. I am a big fan of summoning large monsters to overwhelm my opponent and the deck does exactly that! That turned out to be quite a fortunate coincidence.

TL:DR, A bit difficult (and potentially frustrating) to initially get into, especially if you are unfamiliar with how Yugioh plays. However, it can be a lot of fun if you put some time into understanding the game mechanics and find your niche.

review: Fun game to play, despite the release of master duel it still holds up well as it has many gameplay features that makes it unique compared to master duel. Skills are a great addition to duel links as it allows for greater deck building possibilities and fun matches. Also unlike master duel I don't have the time to go make myself an entire sandwich, clean the house and make some tea during my opponent's turn as duel links is more fast paced. Overall I think its a good game even though it could sometimes feel a bit grindy to get the cards you want if you are a F2P player.

author: {'steamid': '76561199037067818', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1672752417}
review: O jogo é muito bom, tem nem oq dizer, eu estava completamente viciada nele e depois que arrumei um amigo para jogar comigo, esse jogo de cabaço virou minha rotina, realmente fiel com a personalidade dos personagens e ele apresenta uma mecânica simples e interessante, é perfeito para você que é estranho como eu e gosta de repetir as falas do anime enquanto joga só para mascarar seu sentimento interno de inutilidade por estar desperdiçando tanto tempo nesse jogo. O ÚNICO PONTO NEGATIVO É QUE ELE ATUALIZA DE MAIS E SEMPRE DEMORA MT, daqui a pouco vamos precisar de um pc com 1T SÓ PARA ESSE JOGO, parei de jogar pois não estava conseguindo atualizar mais, certo dia deixei ele carregando a noite inteira e mesmo assim não abria depois, vou tentar baixar dnv futuramente mas mds em, q sistema indemoniado. Jogo mt bom recomendo. (outro ponto negativo é q meio difícil encontrar alguém que queira e que saiba jogar, mas isso é só um desabafo meu msm)

author: {'steamid': '76561198289200795', 'num_games_owned': 1177, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1622451773}
review:
It's Yugioh, but faster and with skills.

Honestly I prefer regular Yugioh matches, rather than these quick matches which have their own meta because of the skills system, but it was still fun to play before Master Duel came out.

I personally think that Yugioh already is really difficult because making a 'meta' or even competitively viable deck is really difficult because there are so many cards, and adding skills just makes this that much more difficult. This is probably because I am just not that good at Yugioh, but I still think that the skills just make it too difficult.

Also I do not like the temporary events and time limits on being able to redeem your free card vouchers.

I would still recommend this game if you like Yugioh but I personally prefer Master Duel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073583445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 18376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18376, 'last_played': 1662346552}
review:
Dear Konami,

I beg of you to stop stealing people's money through micro-transactions.  When this game was released, it was good.  Now it is a rotting corpse of a game that only people that never touch grass play.  You have ruined the game to the point where it's simply unplayable without spending $1000 on buying the new meta cards which become obsolete after 1 week.  You are a company of cash grabbing apes that need to be stopped.  When I think about opening this game I feel bad for how many people you have bankrupted from their gambling addictions.  This is worse than CSGO lotto and Fortnite skins combined.  I don't even know why I bother why I write this review because with each key I press I know that you are making more money from your whales that want your $19 fortinite gift cards.  You have ruined this game beyond repair.  Your garbage cut scenes say more than what I can describe in words for how cringe it is.  I can't skip the abhorrent cut scenes no matter how hard I click my mouse.  This cursed game is a disgrace to human kind and deserves to be thrown into a lake of fire.

With utmost hatred and disregard,
I hope this game dies immediately.

review:
Lo tenía en mi celular pero por una falla tuve que reiniciarlo a modo de fábrica, al restaurar el back up el juego no inició con mi cuenta a pesar de tener el Game Center y responder todas las preguntas incluso con otra cuentas que tenia de colegas, el soporte es una mierda, perdí mucho tiempo en esta basura. El soporte de este juego no tiene nada que envidiarle al de Microsoft o al de cualquier empresa pública, simplemente ineficiente, impersonal, absurdo, decepcionante y triste. 

Espero que algún día me devuelvan mi cuenta, no lo recomiendo para nada por el soporte,

author: {'steamid': '76561198247796262', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26504, 'last_played': 1676232612}
review: " Yu-Gi-Oh Duel Links " ➙ Um grande mundo que se encontra Duelistas de todo o mundo. Diversos Players Lendários, um desafio de verdade. Porém como todo fã desta incrível obra, manga e anime, tem suas vantagens e desvantagens: Em minha opinião, este jogo requer paciência e tempo do jogador. Você pode conseguir tudo sendo f2p, porém, requer muito mais tempo do que um p2w. É decepcionante ir rank e ver duelistas com Cards tão fortes e ilimitados como metas, efeitos, que ao entrar no duelo é rendição... É difícil ver pessoas que não ter tempo pra jogar e acabam parando de jogar por causa disso. Enfim, Konami e seus 1 gema para os f2p. Tirando isso e mais, o jogo poderia ser uma LENDA 80% melhor.

review: Darmowa adaptacja gry karcianej ,,Yu-Gi-Oh!''. Niestety, gra nie tłumaczy wielu istotnych zasad osobom, które nie miały wcześniej styczności z papierową wersję tej karcianki. W sumie to rozgrywka z komputerem nawet tego nie wymaga, gdyż sprowadza się do tego, że wystawiamy jakieś karty, atakujemy nimi i wygrywamy. Walki te nie stanowią żadnego wyzwania, co dla mnie osobiście jest ogromną wadą. Dla początkujących mogę za to polecić inną darmową adaptację, a mianowicie: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1449850/YuGiOh_Master_Duel/

review:
Played it a lot on my phone before getting it on steam to get achievements.
 
If you want to play PVE go for it , you can have all the fun you want (without character sounds , they don't work for some reason) 

 Now...the PVP which you have to do from time to time for quests...your opponent in the first 2 turns reads every card 2, 3 times before playing it like it's the first time seeing it. And they play 15 cards in 1 turn which gets them a 3000-5000 damage monster with the effects to destroy your monsters and spells/traps , summon another big boy , double attack and other fun stuff.
 In the meantime you are happy you got to summon a plain text Dark Magician.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228765660', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 18372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2866, 'last_played': 1711057987}
review:
Am Anfang hatte ich Skepsis weil die Decks und das Spielfeld so klein sind aber jetzt macht das Spiel mega bock. Weil einfach für jeden Spielertyp was dabei ist egal ob du auf Anime Duelle stehst oder pvp.
Und durch die Einschränkungen ist auch wieder eine gewisse Balance da die in neuen yugioh komplett schon abgedriftet ist und unspielbar ist mit den 20 Minuten Spielzüge. Ich sag mal duel masters. 
Die ironie ich war kein Fan von duel links weil das Spiel kürzer wird aber tatsächlich überlebt man jetzt mehr runden als in duel masters.
Es freut mich wie hier ein einfaches Dimensionsgefängnis den Gegner schon den Tag versauen kann oder man seine alten Harpyien rauskramen kann wenn man sie ein bisschen mit xyz monster spielt.

author: {'steamid': '76561199134836045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 23442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14551, 'last_played': 1698605086}
review: I loved the Yu-Gi-Oh! anime growing up and Duel Links was made with that audience in mind. It has a large and ever-expanding cast of playable and unlock-able characters from each different series of the anime. From the OG Duel Monsters series with Yugi & Kaiba, right up until the V-RAINS series as of the recent Link summoning update. All of these characters are voiced by their respective voice actors from the shows too and that's a massive plus. Mix that with a faster-paced and more casual approach to the Yu-Gi-Oh! card game and Duel Links is easily my favourite free-to-play game that I've played, as well as a top 5 entry for Yu-Gi-Oh! video games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164670585', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1578, 'last_played': 1601892466}
review:
Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links is a collectible card game that has gained a significant following among fans of the original Yu-Gi-Oh! anime and manga series. The game, which is available on iOS and Android devices, allows players to create and customize their own decks featuring their favorite characters and monsters from the series and duel against other players online.

Overall, I really enjoyed my time with Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links. The gameplay is smooth and intuitive, with a tutorial mode that does a great job of introducing new players to the mechanics of the game. The sound effects and music are well done, with the iconic theme songs from the anime series adding an extra layer of nostalgia for fans of the show. The graphics are also fairly good for a mobile game, with the character and monster designs looking faithful to their counterparts in the anime.

One aspect of the game that I particularly appreciated was the variety of modes available to play. In addition to the standard ranked and unranked duels, there are also special events featuring unique challenges and rewards, as well as a story mode that allows players to relive classic moments from the anime series. This helps to keep the game feeling fresh and gives players a reason to come back and play more.

While the game is certainly enjoyable, there are a few areas that could be improved upon. One issue I had was with the in-game purchases, which can give players an advantage over their opponents by allowing them to buy new cards or packs. While it's not necessary to spend real money to be successful in the game, it can certainly give players an edge and may turn off those who don't want to spend extra money on a mobile game. Additionally, the load times for certain modes and events can be a bit slow at times, which can be frustrating when trying to jump into a quick match.

Comparing Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links to other collectible card games, I would say that it holds up well. The gameplay is solid and the inclusion of characters and monsters from the anime series adds an extra layer of depth for fans of the show. While the in-game purchases and slow load times can be a bit of a drawback, they don't detract too much from the overall experience. Overall, I would give Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links a 8 out of 10. It's a fun and engaging game that's sure to appeal to fans of the series and collectible card games in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010208080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 104001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49093, 'last_played': 1698281717}
review:
Honestly, I want to love this game. YGO was the biggest card game for me growing up. There's a lot of good things about this online version, but there's a lot more negatives than positives. The format isn't horrible, but the staples and packs are very poorly distributed. Furthermore, the insane amount of ingame popups really eats away at my soul when booting up the game, and there's no way to disable them permanently (only day-to-day).

I wish they had streamline more of the UI, because the music, the special effects, art style are quite nice. It's the clunky nature of the overall game that drags down the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815702901', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8189, 'last_played': 1675174455}

Apesar dos probleminhas de conexão, eu gostei bastante.

As artes (tanto 3D quanto 2D) são muito bonitas e algumas animações de invocação são incríveis. Como usuário ávido de dragão branco de olhos azuis e artista aprecio muito o que fizerão com a animação de invocação da carta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093847850', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 21344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16496, 'last_played': 1685568497}
review:
I'd like to ease into this review by giving a little context. I am a long-time Yu-Gi-Oh fan, I loved it as a kid almost twenty years ago and, to some degree, I continue to love it to this day. Things have changed since then, like a childhood friend you haven't seen since you moved away from your hometown, but nevertheless the game still has some of it's charm. You can continue to play most of the decks and play most of the cards you used to, if you're like me, but they're overall success is dependent on the meta.

The Yu-Gi-Oh meta has greatly changed since then but this review isn't about the meta, or the TCG per se, instead this review is about Duel Links specifically.

Duel links, unlike similar TCGs such as Hearthstone, is extremely accommodating to newer players giving them ample opportunity to buy card packs through a method other than in-game purchases, although they are available to you, as well as auto-deck building tools, pre-made deck sets and more.

Sure there are other places you could be playing Yu-Gi-Oh but, in my personal opinion, this is a good place to start and a greater place to stay.

author: {'steamid': '76561199090259170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1674240773}
review: Eu sou um pai de 45 anos, provavelmente uma das pessoas mais velhas a jogar este jogo. Sou pai solteiro criando meu filho, que agora tem 14 anos. Meu filho ganhou este jogo no Natal de 2021 de seu tio, então o instalamos em seu computador e ele começou a jogar. Até o final da semana ele tinha 24 horas neste jogo. Isso foi horrível para mim, pois já era difícil encontrar maneiras de passar o tempo com meu filho, pois ele está sempre com os amigos ou apenas assistindo ao YouTube. Então eu decidi fazer uma conta no Steam e pegar esse jogo para ver se eu poderia jogar ao lado dele. Eu comprei o jogo, criei meu caçador e comecei a jogar, mas eu estava preso no que você deveria fazer. Pedi ajuda ao meu filho e ele organizou um jogo para eu participar. Adorei, pois foi o melhor momento que passei com meu filho desde que minha esposa morreu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044682260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1681445380}
review:
I've played Magic, Digimon, WIXOSS, Pokemon, Hearthstone, Keyforge, Transformers, Force of Will.

So I think I have a good understanding of trading card games.

For a long time I was put off by Yugioh from it's art work, but diving deeper into it while I do find many cards subjectively ugly there's some really good art as well especially with newer cards.

From a game perspective, it's solid. The app is on PC and mobile. Fairly stable, sometimes brief "retry connection" errors. The animations, sound effects and voice lines are high quality.

The economy is quite fair giving you premium currency from just playing to buy booster packs, decks, cosmetics. (I would say the economy is vastly more fair than Magic Arenas)

Game play is varied but the meta is win turn 2 or you lose. Which Yugioh is infamous for, and it's kind of annoying. You can add a bunch of counter play traps and spells to your deck but then that ruins your win condition.

>Turn 2: play half your deck to special summon 10 monsters to get 1-3 huge monsters out to one turn K.O.

Going first feels like you auto lose because you can't attack on turn 1. It's a problem but that is Yugioh. 

I'm still a new player, the learning curve is kind of rough but there is a good game here, especially for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561199107244404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 52, 'playtime_at_review': 2440, 'last_played': 1711859211}
review:
Desde o lançamento de Yu-Gi-Oh, diversos foram os jogos que tentaram emular o jogo de cartas em ambientes virtuais. Afirmo sem a menor dúvida, Duel Links foi o primeiro grande sucesso. 
Apesar de possuir regras distintas do jogo tradicional, as adaptações feitas casaram muito bem com o jogo. 
A disponibilidade de cartas que o jogo possui é imensa, praticamente todas existentes. 
Além disso, trazem diversos personagens históricos da franquia, independente de qual geração seja, sem falar nos diferentes ambientes de jogo e personalização que oferece. 
Resumindo: boa interface e boa imersão no universo Yu-Gi-Oh. O jogo possui uma grande quantidade de eventos (alguns repetitivos), mas oferece diversas formas de jogo. 
O modo PvP é bom, mas complicado, bem difícil na verdade; pois quem não coloca dinheiro no jogo fica dependente de determinados decks para subir, e se algum desses decks perderem força, fica difícil encontrar outros. 
No geral, é um bom jogo. A experiência de jogo é ótima, e na data de lançamento foi realmente algo inovador. A parte ruim é que é difícil manter uma regularidade no jogo, e da trabalho conseguir as cartas. Porém para quem gosta de Yu-Gi-Oh, é uma boa pedida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159047939', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1709935252}
review:
El juego te transporta a esa época en la que el anime se encontraba en emisión, vengo de jugarlo en android, acabo de vincularlo a mi cuenta de Steam a través de mi Konami ID, si alguna vez tienen problemas para transferir los datos desde mobile a pc o de pc a mobile escríbanme, con mucho gusto los puedo ayudar.

Hasta el momento me he encontrado una comunidad sana que no entra en discusiones tóxicas al momento de perder, mucho menos te joden cuando te puedan estar ganando (lo digo por Left4Dead), por lo tanto, puedes divertirte y hacer amigos dentro del juego.

Lo recomiendo muchísimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013971930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8229, 'last_played': 1686251158}
review:
Eu gostava bastante, mas depois da nova banlist perdi toda a vontade de continuar jogando, o jogo ta se tornando cada vez mais para aqueles que não gostam de jogar, mas sim de pesquisar na internet como fazer decks apelões e ganhar o jogo em 2 turnos. Para aqueles que querem jogar de verdade, criando seus decks pouco a pouco e mostrando suas habilidades em jogo, saindo de situações complicadas e até ganhando de jogadores com decks meta, bem... não tem o que fazer, pelo menos não conheço nenhum bom jogo de yu-gi-oh, única forma seria tendo as cartas físicas e um amigo que more perto.
talvez se você goste de cartas links e mecânicas atualizadas, você pode gostar do jogo, mas lembre-se que se quiser ganhar os duelos, vai ter q pesquisar bastante, além de farmar cartas e usar as habilidades dos personagens.

review: The skills that you are able to use are getting worse and making it unplayable as it allows your opponent to easily setup to negate any of your plays or to one turn kill you; It also seems to be rigged as every time that I have spent some money (about $5 or more) I would go on a massive win streak for a day or two. When no money has been spent then it is almost a constant losing streak with the occasional small win streak to get promoted a rank. I have changed my decks multiple times to counter the meta to then keep only facing decks that counter my deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198820256436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2163, 'last_played': 1703613641}
review:
Yu-Gi-Oh Duel Links é bom? Já vou adiantando e dizendo que sim, é um bom jogo

 Duel Links é um bom jogo mas pode ser frustrante para novos jogadores, já que de inicio pode soar um jogo complexo e difícil, até porque caso tu não tenha um bom deck ou não saiba direito as coisas ele pode ser bem difícil nos modos online( porque os xing xong viciado vão invocar 4 monstro de 3000 de ATK e te derrotar em um turno) com o tempo pode acabar ficando mais fácil, no "offline"(NPCS) o jogo pode ser fácil, servindo como treino e teste de decks.

Um outro ponto positivo é que o jogo é muito leve, roda em qualquer PC, até porque foi um jogo lançado para celular também.
 
Ele também é um jogo bom para se ter como uma base, mesmo sendo bem diferente do TCG/OCG e por consequência é bem diferente do Master Duel( que é bem ruim comparado ao Duel Links)

Um ponto negativo é que o jogo é um pouco P2W (Pay to win), mas não é impossível de jogar sem gastar dinheiro ( até hoje não gastei um único centavo no jogo e me divirto bastante com o jogo)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998824356', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 65863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65863, 'last_played': 1669607177}
review:
Pros:
- Can grind character EXP for gems.
- Always have events running.
- Simpler and shorter than the standard format (could be a cons for some).
- Cards in the boxes are guaranteed as long as you keep digging. Still expensive though.

Cons:
- Can't craft cards like in Master Duel.
- Cheat character skills that can change/nerf for the publisher to drive sales to new box.
- Outdated cards. So many cards still not released.
- Selection boxes are paywalled, although they can be gotten from dream tickets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341771785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1679229096}
review:
Ob das eher ein Handy Spiel ist? Das Bildschirmformat ist schon verdächtig...
Das allerschlimmste ist aber das man bei jeden login so dermaßen zu geknallt wird mit irgendwelchen Events, neuen Kartenpacks, Duellaten, irgendwelchen Belohnungen, neue Sachen die sich immer wieder wiederholen bloß anders aussehen, irgendwelchen Spezial Event und und und...
Man muss erstmal sich mehrere Minuten durch alles durchklicken bis man spielen kann.  
Ja, keine Ahnung wer zu viel an den Karten gerochen hat das man nur 3 Monster-, Zauber/Fallenkarten Zonen hat aber das ist definitiv nicht geil.
Ich geh lieber das richtige YuGiOh! spielen. 
Oder Legacy of Duelist. (Meine Empfehlung)

author: {'steamid': '76561198142797044', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 11504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5188, 'last_played': 1694623751}
review:
Как бы мне помягче описать игру и без мата? Рандом и ебаные деки, с почти каждым паком выходит контр-дека предыдущей имбо-деки. Да, возможно это грешок всех картонок, но сейчас последние деки это долбаный сюр. Когда твой противник берет и призывает на следующем после тебя ходу за ТВОИХ же монстров себе тварину на 3к урона, а суть твоей деки игра через одного монстра на поле, а не йобнутый спам по 4 монстра за ход, это конечно очень классно. Молчу о том, что на деках имбовых год назад сейчас в рейтинге тебя уже на золоте начнут насиловать и выигрывать на первом ходу противники, которые в игре от силы пару месяцев.

Upd. Убрали русский язык- спасибо, и так больше половины свойств карт было непонятно, теперь все на ингрише, у меня один вопрос- игроки из России-то что вам сделали Конами?

author: {'steamid': '76561197991585188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 171215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 756, 'playtime_at_review': 124469, 'last_played': 1712372713}
review:
Some people think that this game is obsolete since Master Duel is released.
But Master Duel cannot replace Duel Links in many ways. Duel Links has many things that makes it much better for many players. Some of them that come into my mind:
1. Actual anime characters with their personalities
2. Voice lines during battle
3. Special 3D animations for summons of iconic monsters
4. PvE. A lot of PvE for those who doesn't like PvP that much.
5. Interesting events with storyline, dialogues, jokes etc.
6. Unique rewards for events, be it cards or skills. I like the feeling of getting something special for participating in the event, not only gems.
7. Skills. This makes deckbuilding and the game itself incredibly different from a regular game without skills. Also this allows building decks that are not possible to make in a game without skills.
8. Length of the game. In no way I can spend 30+ minues on 1 duel. Sometimes I have to wait over 5 minutes while my opponents makes a turn in Master Duel.
9. Consistency of the decks. Since there are only 20 cards in the deck, and still 3 copies of a card - I can see the cards I want more often.
10. New beta mode called Legacy duels. Finally there is a way to play oldschool battles without all new summon mechanics.
11. Excitement while opening booster boxes. The excitement I feel while spending my hard-earned gems on a box is comparable to the one I feel in real life while opening packs. When I open the single I want from the first 10 packs out of 200 - that's insane amount of emotions Master Duels in uncapable of providing. Crafting any card you want is convenient and fast, but dull and emotionless.
